lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So thank you for joining us, Patrick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at his beautiful office and all his beautiful owlbears.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many owlbears!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's beautiful. Cool, so before we get into the game tonight, let's go ahead and do our announcements. First and foremost, we are starting with our first official sponsorship of the year with the return of Lootcrate. Thank you so much for being amazing supporters of the show and we're excited to get started. Liam, you wanted to talk about this one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay! So Lootcrate, the January theme is not 'taint' or 'fisting', it's 'origins'. The brands are Superman, Marvel, TMNT, Nintendo, I know everyone here's familiar. The cutoff-- you have to order now, the cutoff is 9PM tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 9PM tonight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you gotta go get got, and you want to go to lootcrate.com/criticalrole. Not critrole, but lootcrate.com/criticalrole. And the promo code is 'criticalrole', one word, for 10% off your first month.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rockin'.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also taint.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, Lootcrate. We're glad to have you back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We can't talk about the taint theme. That doesn't happen until April.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So excited about it, though. Just so excited.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There are some exclusives.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I cannot say enough good stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Laura, you wanted to talk about stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we keep these?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no, these are for us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yay! These will stink in a week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please bring them back next week and show us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I just tell everybody how much I miss having you next to me, boo?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sad you're not over here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, we're not in character yet, right? I miss you too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aww. Stop it. Next thing I want to announce is there's a convention coming up in February called Anime Milwaukee, February 17-19, in which me, Marisha, Travis, and Laura will be in attendance as guests. So come join us for an awesome Critical Role panel, we'll have signings throughout the weekend, our other panels about voiceover and other elements of chaos. So if you're in that area, please come and say hi. Bring things for us to sign.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, bring a bathing suit, I hear there's a pool party on Saturdays in the negative-two-degree weather.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, god. Is it really that cold?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. It's Milwaukee.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's by the lake, too, you got that lake-effect air.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dress warm, just in case. Anything else anyone wishes to discuss or mention? Patrick, anything you wanna mention?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You guys are coming to my state? You're gonna be in Wisconsin? When's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is February 17-19.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah. Come see us!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll see, I'll check my calendar to see, that'll be a short trip if you're just down in Milwaukee.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, Patrick dinner.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That would be awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. (laughs) Yeah, that was a great countdown. So, to bring us into the story, and get you guys up to speed, the adventuring group of Vox Machina had been battling the Chroma Conclave, a collection of ancient chromatic dragons that had terrorized the Tal'Dorei countryside, ruined a number of the villages and cities, their leader, Thordak the Cinderking, lording over the capital city of Emon for a number of weeks at this point. In order to prepare themselves for this battle, they have traversed the planes and all across the world to acquire Vestiges of Divergence, these powerful artifacts, and upon acquiring them and gathering allies, they made an assault, with the help of these allies, upon the city of Emon, defeated Thordak the Cinderking, and, after making an alliance with one of these Conclave members, Raishan, the Diseased Deceiver, to aid them in this battle, they ended up battling Raishan as well within Thordak's lair beneath the city. Raishan nearly annihilated the entirety of the group Vox Machina, kept at bay only by them summoning one of their allies, J'mon Sa Ord, the powerful brass dragon and secret leader of the city of Ank'harel. Enough of a threat to push her away, Raishan took the corpse of Thordak, apparently via teleportation, as well as two of the eggs that remained in the lair, and vanished. Upon wrestling your way outside of the lair itself, you came upon a number of allies who had fought their way to the center of the city, as well as Patrick's character Kerrek, who had brought a number of his ragtag adventurers from the city of Westruun to aid. Kerrek joined you in your return to Whitestone, and has now agreed to aid you in your search for the current whereabouts of Raishan. Through the use of some rather rapid scry magic and the dragon's spent capability to defend against it at the time, you found the location of Raishan, apparently a distant island to the far south in the Lucidian Ocean, one that once was the lair of Thordak before he was sealed, and before that, apparently belonged to a necromancer named Opash. You then spent the evening in Whitestone-- or, I guess, the day, since you slept through the day-- in Whitestone, preparing to rest for a coming conflict, giving chase to Raishan in hopes of stopping whatever her plans are before they come to fruition. So. That is when we dive back in. So all of you guys have had a full night's rest, you're back up to your full hit points, you regain half of your spent hit dice. Spells are back. I know we had a few characters level. We had Scanlan level, Percy levelled, and Pike levelled.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we're just gonna choose an eighth-level for Pike, but it won't stick if she wants to not have that be it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Sure. It's fine, as a cleric, you have access to all the cleric spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so she doesn't have to choose one like a ranger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no, no. That's kind of the benefits of the cleric and the wizard, is they have a larger breadth of spells, druids as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's great. Well, never mind!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're gonna pick Power Word Kill Green Dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, Power Word Kill Green Dragon for her eighth-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's taking Power Word Kill?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Green Dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Specifically.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can she do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I was just like, is that allowed?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. If you guys wanna get your-- any attunement changes you want to situate for the coming party company move.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I would like my boots back, and I've been sort of dreading this moment. Can I have my boots back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They look so good on me. Have you noticed?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all I've noticed for the last 24 hours when we were fighting. I mean, we probably would've killed her yesterday, but I was so distracted by how good you looked in the boots, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, like, really good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Strategically, I think I can actually do more, and I think I'm more likely to get a little more bang for my buck out of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really? Strategically, you can do more than me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Never mind. I'll use the sword--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no, I'll give them to you, I'll give them to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was as painful as I imagined it would be.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It could've been worse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, it could've been. Percy, would you like this sword back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or anybody. Yeah, the sword.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's the Dragonkilling sword.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just, I'm better when I'm maneuverable, and I feel like I'm gonna get one swing and a miss and it go to waste.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeez. Who needs it? Can anybody take it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will admit, if I get within striking distance, I'm probably--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I see it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure you can. Here's the handle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Proper handling techniques.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, really? (gasps) I'll have it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I do stealth cloak or should I do--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have also taken some time to inspect the other items that you received from the treasure hoard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get me out of this bench situation!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gimme those, gimme those, gimme those boots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Boots to Keyleth, and this to whoever, the hammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The hammer. There's a hammer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a warhammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Who found a warhammer? I was asleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not even going to read it, Keyleth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Chapter one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, wait. The Dwarven Thrower, this is the warhammer. Okay. You gain a +3 attack bonus, bonus to attack and damage rolls. It has a thrown property. Normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet, Grog. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra 1d8 damage or, if the target is Giant, which a dragon is, 2d8 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like an actual giant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, 'is a giant'. Never mind. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Another one of those secrets she was telling me about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's Thor-hammerish. Does require attunement by a dwarf.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if I've got a dwarvish beard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have the Belt of Dwarvenkind attuned, you can attune to the hammer as well. But only under that condition. If you unattune the belt, you have to unattune the hammer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you have to give Matt $20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so happy right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, that as well. I forgot that on the card.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kerrek, are you secretly a dwarf?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I noticed you haven't actually given me the boots back, and I just wanted to remind you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, let me find the fucking piece of paper. Jeez.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's very important. I'm also going-- oh, you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on dexterity stealth checks that rely on moving silently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, but I don't know what else Pike has attuned on her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that one I don't think requires attunement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Pass 'em over, Pike will wear them! They don't need attune? Wow, I'll write them down on her sheet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But she will not have her Boots of Levitation. Or no, she will not have her Sprinter's Boots. Sprinter's Boots will be replaced by those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, what are the chances that she's gonna need to bolt? Probably more than sneak around. Probably?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a choice to make.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, here's a question: can she have the boots on and then right before the battle put on the Sprinter's Boots?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sprinter's Boots do require attunement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it's not like you can attune them and then take them off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know if they do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sprinter's Boots are pretty clutch for Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, they're pretty clutch, especially after the last time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going to brawl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we're going stealthy, probably, before--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you. The process of a giant, armored gnome to change out her boots is gonna be-- it's not like a quick, it's not pressing the 'x' button in your inventory.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like changing from one pair of ski boots into another pair of ski boots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So be mindful of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Minor thing, I'm going to attune the Deathwalker's Ward to necrotic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To necrotic. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, then, how's your stealth, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have spider-boots.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you have spider-boots. What about you, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Huh? What was the question? Sorry, I'm drooling all over this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you mind-- can I put 'em on for now? Since I gave him back his boots. Is that okay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, my stealth is pretty all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's got leaping boots.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that a Thor hammer, is that thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's pretty fucking close. Apparently I throw it, it comes right back to my hand. If I had Frenzied Rage and three attacks, would it go (whack whack whack) like a giant yo-yo?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically yes?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (hyperventilates) I'm taking this one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far can you throw that thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's 20 feet and then 60 feet is the second range increment, so if it's longer than 20 feet, your attacks are at disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you can still attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if I did Reckless Attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then it would be no more roll, and then everyone gets advantage against you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love you right now. If these two tables weren't in our way...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Love the dice that rolled that treasure hoard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ugh, what's all over the bottom of the table after the show?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mayonnaise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is there anybody else that wanted to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to attune to this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the Dwarven Thrower?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. Not the Blood Axe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so the Blood Axe goes away. Dwarven Thrower's out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cabal's, Dragonslayer, Animus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, just so you're aware, the dice roll on that is a d8 to do damage, as opposed to a d12.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. That doesn't sound as cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I must think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna do my circlet, my antlers, as always, Ring of Protection, Spire of Conflux.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Just to chime in, out of character, I know we picked up the dancing sword, which could act as an autonomous fighting thing, but I don't know who has that or who has slots available to attune.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is-- Grog has that, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog has every weapon ever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it an attunement thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to attune to it, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're a Fallout character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yes, Grog does have the sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have an extra spot, Kerr? To attune?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm gonna show my age, here. You know, I have only occasionally done 5th edition, back in the day when I got used to playing, we never attuned our weapons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you only have two things attuned. You do, you can.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: So I'm relatively easy in terms of what magic items. I could have it and set it loose at the beginning of combat, if nobody else can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog pulls the sword out from the Bag of Holding, and as he reaches and extends it towards you, you feel this sudden almost like a sudden burst of headache at the back of your mind, and you stop for a second, Grog, and you look at the blade. And there across the metallic sheen of this gorgeous scimitar, you see this image begin to seep through and look at you. It's this female-like face, very faint, a reflection--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Female setting!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the teeth are fanged, and you see what looks to be almost like a swirl of snakes around the outside. At that moment, you feel that burst of headache in the back of your head grow extremely strong, and you drop the blade out of your hand, and you guys watch as Grog falls to his knees, just clutching the sides of his head. The sword, as it hits the ground, it clacks. The blade almost immediately rusts and turns into a dark, dull metal. The gems crack and turn to dust, and what now lies there is an inert weapon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the fuck?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What did you do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, did it turn you really, really, really stupid?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That really hurt, and it's still hurting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, how many fingers am I holding up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Square.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, he's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That magic sword bit me. That really hurt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it just because it's only meant for you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kerrek, do you still want it? (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Do I have any idea, like, was this thing rejecting me or pissed that Grog was abandoning it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense, just 'cause you've seen a few things like this, that this was actually an inherent curse within the blade, and it just took a moment to dig itself into Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the source of the curse is expended, and Grog, you are permanently at -2 to all of your saving throws. Correcting my mistake from the card last session.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is the Deck of Many Things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This was me completely either misreading or mishearing it last time, as the internet let me know that was the card drawn, I want to make sure that we stick to what was drawn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't have a problem with that, I do have a problem with the headache. Can we maybe bargain to get the headache removed? 'Cause I'm really--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need BC Powder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think Grog has a way to get rid of headaches.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything's going to be seen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So -2 to all of his saving throws?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Permanently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, until a god takes it away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A god? No, go talk to the Raven Queen or somebody. Sarenrae! (gasps) Maybe she can Greater Restoration, if Pike realizes what it is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stupid sword. Jeez, me and swords. Just really not doing well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike, can you take a look at your buddy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, do you have a headache?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog is clutching the side of his head. Pike just came up to you and asked you a question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What'd she say?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a headache?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do. Do you have anything to help with it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I can maybe do like a Cure Wounds, or--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not wounded, it's just a headache. Do you have Cure Headache?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so, but I can pray to Sarenrae if it would help?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know, it's out of my league. I mean, maybe, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I-- is there anything I have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to try?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike is just universally cute. She's like a kigurumi, if you wear it, you're just automatically cute.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just insta-cute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I know what to do? Would she know what to do to try to help him at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it's a curse, I mean, there are a few things that can usually take care of a regular curse, but she doesn't understand the nature of this curse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I can try to do a-- I don't know what level Greater Restoration is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a 5th-level.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's only a headache. I'll be fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we all just healed, I'm fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Let me know if you need anything, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, yeah, I will. Thank you, Pike.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Coming into this fight down two on all saves...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have anything sitting around that's not attuned, though--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike got that cloak that fucking Hotis glued to my flesh off. That's I think what she did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, if you want, also, you can have my Ring of Protection, which is a Ring of Protection +2, and it gives you +2 to AC and to all your saving throws. I was gonna wear it, but I could wear the Cloak of Displacement instead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not a real big jewelry fan. Do I have to attune to it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah, I don't want it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, though, Keyleth, that's very sweet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're welcome. It's a little bit of a girly ring, so I understand. Well, you're full on attunements, right? You're full up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's gonna try to do Greater Restoration on Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did it do anything for my gas?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no divine magic that can do anything about that either, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was worth a try, though, because that would've been helpful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I cannot find my card for my Ring of Lightning Resistance. It seems to have vanished.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know where it would have gone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have anything else equipped that we can--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't say it the last time, but Trinket's out of the necklace, and he healed overnight, 'cause he's low too.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Out of character, I will say, if anyone has anything that they're not using in terms of--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, we do!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm reasonably geared up, I'll be able to go in and hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you wearing armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has chainmail.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so the Bracers of Defense wouldn't work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, would the cloak work with armor, right? It wouldn't replace his armor, a cloak?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the cloak can go over armor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you okay with that, Vax? Kerr, we have this Cloak of Displacement that's pretty awesome, if you want to wear it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's made from the flesh of a flying manta ray-type thing, and it makes you really hard to hit, and this is a loaner--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's actually made from the flesh of a displacer beast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that, I know. I also have a very precious ring which I would love to have back from you once we've killed this dragon, but you will not be seen if you wear it.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I would put that to good use in the coming fight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I take the cloak and I throw it over him. You gonna tweet it to him? Or text it to him? Whatever.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I slap the ring down into his palm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a picture of the ring?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A picture of the ring?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a Ring of Invisibility?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a thing? No?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I have a thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just a legendary ring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a legendary ring like you do. Just note, with the Ring of Invisibility, you remain invisible until the ring is removed, until you attack or cast a spell, or until you use a bonus action to become visible again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If anyone has anything better to give him, we could do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's really good. That's a badass ring.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, Siri, remind me to ask Patrick Rothfuss for my Ring of Invisibility back once the dragon is dead. We're good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Assisting D&D games since 2000-something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. What else do you guys want to prepare, if anything, as you wake up, come to consciousness--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should have a Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we should.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anybody that could do a Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, how are you looking on Feasts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, if Pike wants to prepare a Heroes' Feast, Pike can cast it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can Gilmore?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was a one-time thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gilmore had a few items that basically turned into a Heroes' Feast, but he lost his shop.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay. Pike can do another-- what level is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heroes' Feast. It is, I believe, 6th-level, I think. Yes, 6th-level.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why're we having a Feast? Are we going to fight something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's breakfast. It's the most important meal of the day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right. I feel terrible for not realizing that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so we all have Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. Mark your diamond that you recently found in the hoard, marked off, as Pike prepares a long wooden table, summoned through divine magic, that contains a fantastic meal of all the classic Westruun comfort foods, instilled with the power and guidance of Sarenrae. As you spend the additional hour to eat and drink and gain the effect of the spell, you become immune to poison, immune to fear, and you all get an additional 2d10 to your maximum hit points, if you want to roll that, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Well, this is for everybody. Everybody gets this amount.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's not bad, that's not bad. That's a 15 added for everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So everybody gets 15 additional hit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm assuming Trinket is eating and Allura is eating?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can feed up to 12 people, so yes. That would be Kerr as well, and Allura, and Kima.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We get advantage on what saves?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fear and poison.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you're immune to fear and immune to poison.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't get advantage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Advantage on wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wisdom saving throws. All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I attuned-- by the way, my Bracers of Archery are attuned again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You reattuned to your Bracers of Archery? Cool. All righty. So.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should I do a Scrying Eye, see if I can still find Raishan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but what should you scry on? Can you scry on Thordak's body or something? 'Cause she would have it right next to her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have the ball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's either a creature or location.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well, if right now we're pretty sure that they don't know we know where they are, do we want to risk that? Losing the surprise?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't. If I scry on her cave, would that tip her off? The cave of Opash?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Only one way to find out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only one way to find out?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm of the opinion that-- personally, I think it's safer to know what we know now and go in, because if things--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I can always teleport us there and scry there. That way, at least-- minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, when you create a sensor at a location, creatures that can see invisibility can see the actual scrying location, the orb itself that you create, the magical orb of which your vision appears through. But that's the only thing you would have to consider.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a massive thing to consider.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unless she's in, like, perma-bubble-bath world or something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should just go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we should, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeez! I'm so nervous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm feeling strangely positive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -2, playas.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you put that piece of wood down, please?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's eating wood again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We need to get him another salt lick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do miss my salt lick rock. Can I keep an eye out as we walk around for another salt lick rock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't make me do that. Ooh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God, the sound those things make.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like your dice have a subwoofer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're generally just bits of whitestone or rock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, that's caca!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Find your own!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let him lick it if he wants it. It's just gonna make him happy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it close to salty? Could I confuse it with salt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you get a hint of salt, but it's gone after the first lick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: More shiny than the others?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After licking it a few times, it gets a little shinier, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am a great sorcerer. I will keep this new stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So go ahead and mark three quartz rocks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Palm-sized?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roughly. Some are a little bigger. The center one is a little bit like a basketball size.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bag of Holding, you've got new occupants.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Putting rocks in the Bag of Holding. Just filling it with rocks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rocks and like dried poo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't judge his collection.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ox, oxen, troll dicks, pet rocks, just a bunch of pet rocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima's fully armored.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does she look badass? In her full sorceress armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, Allura?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's an upper-middle-class girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's wearing one of her many ceremonial robes that she does for presentory Tal'Dorei Council work, but you see she has a hood up over her head, her hair braids are tied together behind her neck so they don't get in the way. You notice that there is some really nice jewelry that's adorning the side of her neck. The staff she carries with her usually is relatively simple, but you see now that there are a number of runes carved in a spiral along the sides of it. You can see a number of rings that she previously wasn't wearing that are on, and her face is hardened, and you see that she-- where normally she has this air of keeping the room-- almost a teacher or parental-type presence in the area, there's an intensity and darkness to her face that you haven't really seen before. Not since at least the attack on the city happened.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Work!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings) Allura!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sings) And Kima.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have we put all of our affairs in order?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I hate when you put it that way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kima got the Feast, too, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They come in towards the beginning of the casting of the Feast, and they eat as well, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a buffet. It's a Heroes' Buffet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. How best should we arrive? If you have the ability to bring us through the tree, or I can "teleport us there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it the same difference?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What power-- how much energy do you use when you teleport?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as the advancement of spell strength, a Teleport spell in its own right is the "seventh sphere of magical incantation."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm. Then let me go with our Transport Via Plants, which is more of a six, you know, level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sounds like a wondrous idea."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worst-case scenario, we can camp for the night, if are victorious and spent.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love camping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it looks like a very pretty island.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's make sure that one of the Gate Stones is left here in case one of us has to make a mad dash.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give it to Cassandra?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give it, obviously, keep it in Cassandra's care. If somebody comes back, you know everything's gone horribly wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima rushes over and takes the stone from your hand and goes, "All right, I'll give it to "her. Be right back." She jogs off. You hear the (clanging) of the armor as she disappears

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe we should give--

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: -- her the boots.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not a bad call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, you know what? When Kima comes back, I'm gonna give her the Elven boots, so she can be quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes them and is like, "Not really my style."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just saying, you're loud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll take 'em." And you all wait patiently for the next six minutes as she unbuckles and pulls off the rest of her lower armor and gets the boots on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That don't match at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. And you can see it gives her a twinge of disappointment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like different tiered armors in Warcraft. It's the worst.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Slips her Doc Martens over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With you all gathered there, Allura, hood still up, kind of nods. "Keyleth, lead the way. To the Sun Tree, then?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To the Sun Tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. (sighs) Let us hope that we return here tomorrow victorious." She swirls around, her cloak spinning around her base as she follows suit after you, Keyleth, the rest of you make your way, marching down the front of Castle Whitestone to the center of the town, where there you see the faint elements of green bloom now growing across the tree from where once it was bare, the season bringing a sense of spring and summer that have been kept at bay for a while. And for you as well, Percival, this is the first time in a long time you've seen the Sun Tree showing that growing life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I quietly sneak up and give it a good kiss.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw. I see it, and I'm like. You know, I know him. I can put in a good word.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really? We talk all the time, he never mentions you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we ready?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what are you focusing on for the receiving end of this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming I found a tree that was close to her cavern that's big enough?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yes, you can choose one of those trees you saw that would be large enough to do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan stops us before we start. For the record, this is a terrible idea and we have no plan. Just putting it out there. I'm with you, this is a terrible plan, and we're going to die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You seem different.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm fine. I have a cold. I don't feel well. I'm taking something for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sing me a song. Sing me a song right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not singing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I try to stealthily sniff Scanlan. Does he smell like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't ever say the word.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And yet she still slowly crawls up and begins taking a big whiff on your shoulder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sniffs) Ah, so nervous.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There once was a barbarian named Grog, who had the IQ of a log-- I'd keep going, but now you're excited, and you've made me lose my--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he smell like the incense that I smelled from him before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. He smells of frustration, disappointment, and worry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You smell like a sad man. All right, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right. So do you go ahead and cast the spell? All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace on all of us before we go through the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as the shadows coalesce around your bodies, your legs, your knees, your feet, you watch as the front of the Sun Tree suddenly splits open to reveal the pathway through across to what looks to be a partially ruined jungle. You all step through the tree quickly before the portal slams shut behind you, and as you guys emerge, looking about, you can see what looks to be a lot of heavy dirt and earth that-- there's spatterings of sand throughout, and surrounding it immediately, you can see there are different trees throughout this kind of-- some points are lush green jungle on the outside, and the further in you go, you watch as the trees have all withered black. A little ways over the treeline, you can see maybe a quarter-mile off what looks to be the top of the mountain that a brief instant of your first vision in your Scry spell lent you towards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like the blight of the trees is getting more concentrated the closer to the top of the mountain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it's a radial effect from the actual mountain, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it look like fire damage or something else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want to go ahead and take a look? Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Stand back. 11 minus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You can't recall the color, really, that they've become, but it's not alive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In a big circle. Like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, is this what happens when you pee on trees?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that not normal?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should talk with Pike when we get home. Make sure you're okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, do you need me to cast another Greater Restoration? For your--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, his bladder infection's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It can keep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes a Wish spell to get rid of that, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not ashamed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He and Scanlan both.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did he find anything out? Did you find anything out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he didn't find anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: These trees aren't alive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fancy that. That's good. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys begin to walk through-- it's not a very dense jungle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We want to keep quiet as we do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so make stealth checks as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have Pass Without a Trace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes you do, so plus ten to all your stealth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Pew-pew-pew!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pew-pew-pew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And, actually-- I rolled with disadvantage for Kima, and it was like a 16 and a four, but then she had the boots on, so the first one sticks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 24 for Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. So, stealthily, you guys-- what did you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled 33 and Scanlan rolled 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus ten.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the plus ten?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How did you do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, well, Kerr, what did you get?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: 14 for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus ten?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Where did that plus ten come from?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From Pass Without a Trace!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A spell that she had cast on all of you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys fan out in this-- (computer chime)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now boarding: Star Tours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks for that, Microsoft Outlook.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All these trees look like they had the life force pulled from them, almost like a very, very rapid starvation, or thirst took them, but what's interesting is a lot of these trees are near-petrified and have been this way for a very long time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was gonna be my question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a recent occurrence.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So like the petrified forest in Arizona?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of, yeah. But a sadder version, if that's possible. They're all like "ehh, I'm a bad tree."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do I know about Opash and the crimes and what sort of tinkering?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What little you do know is that he was sent away specifically because of his inquiries into how far you can reach with necromantic magics, and lost history from the Age of Arcanum.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's good to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Age of Arcanum was the epoch before the Divergence, before the Calamity hit, and not a lot of history exists about it, a lot of it was destroyed either during the battle, or people destroyed it thereafter to prevent us from reusing what led to that sort of conflict. But Opash apparently had gathered, or at least was in the process of trying to recover, some of that information.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So these trees have been dead for hundreds of years.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hundreds of years, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So the scarring does not seem recent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And there's no new scarring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There does not appear to be any new scarring that you can tell based on what you've seen so far.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's very good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I see any sign of tracks or anything? Dragon tracks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dragging of giant carcasses or just, y'know, footprints.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yellow 'Dragon Crossing' signs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Advantage, 'cause it's a dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it's dragon-related.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is dragon-related. Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. There are no dragon tracks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Motherfucker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She licks a tree. "No dragon has been here." (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet there's other tracks, though, that I totally missed 'cause I was looking for dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look for anything other than dragons? There won't be an advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really want that 20, but I don't get it. This one is not as good. Is this an investigation? Perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this would be investigation for you, sitting down and getting close and looking throughout the dirt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11? You do find tracks, but they're scattered and they're small feet. Looks like some indigenous creatures or wildlife that exists on this landscape.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. But they were little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were all little, yeah. As you guys push through, Allura looks up toward the boughs of the dead trees. "While you were preparing, I did some research on this island, and it seems that there "were an indigenous people that lived here before Opash came. Thousands that made seaward trade "routes to the north and the west, and when he made this his home, the indigenous people were never "heard from again. It is believed by many who fare the seas that this land is cursed and is to be "avoided for that reason. This forest, one of the superstitious points of that reasoning, there are "a few that come through hoping to scavenge or find things from his lost whereabouts, or his own hoard "or treasures he may have garnished in his time, but few of those return as well."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There could be anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you read if the island was trapped or any type of arcane presence on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if this was the lair of a necromancer, an entity that is both selfish and "driven towards the personal power and advancement of their own narcissism, I can imagine that they "are very well protected with their secrets. The fact that this abode was taken by Thordak before "he made reign upon the southern side of the continent... who knows what happened to Opash?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thordak made this his abode?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Up until he began to wander onto the continent of Tal'Dorei."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have to find the cave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The gem we created. Me, Kima, Drake. As far as we know, if any of her stories can be believed, "Raishan was responsible for the rituals that embedded it within Thordak's chest on the "Plane of Fire during her time with the Fire Ashari. Once again, as much as we can believe."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's just a lot we don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let us be careful. Press on."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're keeping eyes out for anything that looks different than normal jungle-ness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Carefully.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Investigation checks from both you guys, if you don't mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're looking for traps specifically? Investigation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Pushing forward, you guys--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what I mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. In a very Laura Bailey "how much can I get out of this roll?" I know, I know, I know, I'm just messing with you. So as you guys push forward, you, Vax, notice that the further in you go towards this mountain, the trees, still dead, grey, are even further withered, and many of them have just turned to ash and dust. And the closer you get, the actual treeline grows thinner and lower as it seems like the closer it gets to the mountain, they're bereft of most of their structure. You do, Vex, catch as your brother is moving forward, he is stepping towards a section of the earth and sand that has slightly different texture, ever-so-slightly from the rest, and he's but a few feet from stepping into that space.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax! Stop! There's some weirdness on the ground. I feel like it's something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you think something's up under the ground there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, what do I do at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do? You look down, and you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you see it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks almost like--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna take a closer look, is what I'm gonna do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like the difference between sand and slightly damp sand. The coloration is just ever so faintly--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now that you're looking, now that you're looking, you can tell, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now that I have context. Context is key, as always.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I push him in? No, I'm kidding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it quicksand?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I find a trap if I'm looking closer, now, with her added?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no mechanism there, you don't see a pulley or a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it's magic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much of it looks different?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's avoidable. It's like a ten-, 15-foot oval area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, everyone. Let's just not step on this dark patch, how about that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 'Cause I think it's like magic or something, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like good magic?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like bad magic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kind of bad magic?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The kind that would kill us all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like the kind that gives you a really bad headache.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I really don't want another one of those.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Similar sort of thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Continue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now that you've identified that, you've come across a few more patches, and they seem to grow more dense as the trees grow more withered and gone, until you get to a point where you can now see the base of this mountain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I from a distance maybe do a nature check? Are these almost like siphons, like wells where he was sucking the life force?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or maybe quicksand? This could be all the quicksand we were promised as children.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my gosh. Always quicksand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seriously. Today's kids do not appreciate quicksand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was such a big part of my childhood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why did I never find quicksand? 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. These are less siphons, they're more what looks to be-- it's a phenomenon known as hollow earth, which is when subterranean caverns go into collapse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sinkholes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can create a sinkhole-like phenomenon, but hollow earth generally is based on some sort of magical release, an explosion of magical energy beneath the earth that causes-- even though there is no space, it erodes the earth from its magic presence, whether it just completely disintegrates or destroys portions of the earth, it leaves this very, very unstable portion of ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's like a magical quasar? That blasts out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not entirely certain what it'll do, but it's not good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take one of my new salt lick rocks and I throw it in one of the little sandy pools.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you take the rock and throw it into the sandy pool, it lands with a little bit of dirt being kicked up around it and sits there for a rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, magic, huh? Real scary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would the rock tell you if it was having a headache right now? How would it tell you that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a psychic connection with my rocks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You also weigh a little more--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rock then goes-- it just falls underneath, and you can see a spot in the ground, perfectly shaped where the rock was, that is now just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Told you it was dangerous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I actually did that. It's magic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't step there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You figured it out, Grog, good job.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Weird point of contention for my imagination. Are the trees wilting, or do they seem like there was a bit of a blast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are not leaning a specific direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so there's no pattern to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and it isn't like there are were leaves or anything blown off of them. It just looked like they gradually just died rapidly in place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seems like the closer we get, the deader it gets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see the mountain that we're getting towards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can, and you guys maneuver around these spaces to get to the base of it, and it's a moderate-sized mountain, nothing impressive on the outside, it's maybe 600 feet tall at its apex, it's more of a large, rocky mound. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's nothing in here. Why do I keep trying to sip?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 30 is what I rolled, but that's not as good as a natural 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But 30 is still good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But what's your bonus to perception?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception, oh yeah, is 12. So 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so close. You guys being at the front of the party anyway--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, your perception bonus is higher than mine? When did that happen?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How did you just notice that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who fucking knows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys scoot forward, being ahead of the rest of the party, you glance across the surface of this, and most of the rock follows the familiar pattern of tectonic shift that's broken and cracked in places, but it's been, over hundreds and thousands of years, just settled into its natural state. There is one section of rock just maybe 200 feet from where you are landing at the base where it looks like the texture, the natural lines of the rock, is in a different direction. And upon you heading in that direction, you can see, now, what it appears to be is a large rock, very large, maybe 20, 30 feet wide, that is jammed into an entranceway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I perceive a rock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got a rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of. There are a number of strange holes peppered over the surface.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, big holes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About the size of a-- larger than a gold piece, each hole.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like it could be, like, things could come out of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Possibly?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Checking for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to check it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know what Gilmore would do. Put his hand in it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How very Flash Gordon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 25 for investigation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Investigation, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I need to roll, since he's so good?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Might as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if it's a one? Ooh. No, 24. Damn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got you a water, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, sir. So. Are the rest of you guys following up behind them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just wait a moment, wait a moment. No, hang back for a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it looks like different-- some of them are more weathered than others. This boulder has been placed and pulled back and placed many, many times throughout the years.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's probably too heavy for us to move, but Grog, do you want to try?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if we should move it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, how do we get in if we don't open the entrance?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If nothing else, rather than moving the whole boulder, is there a way we could just get enough of a crack to get in?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can Stone Shape it a little bit thinner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, dig. I like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just so that if the dragon tries to run, they have to move a giant boulder, it would be really convenient.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good call.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like there's-- am I there? I'm not there yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are hanging back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kik.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I'll go up. Is there a crack that looks like it can kind of just whittle it away, that's kind of already started with the boulder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, the boulder is larger than the entranceway that it's jammed into, and you're not entirely certain what the inside of this cavern mouth is, if it's just a direct intersection point or if it's a gradual influx. You can just try and push through at one of those points if you'd like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you just put a hole in the middle, like right in the center of the boulder, on the ground?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or would it be easier just to scrape across the side?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I only have a limited amount of space that I can carve out, so the boulder might be too thick, but if I do it at the seam line, I should be able to do it. I want to do it at the seam.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to take the first entrance that we find, I mean, is it really one way in, one way out? What if it's just, like, a trap?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does someone want to check for traps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They already checked. It did not appear to be trapped, just a very, very heavy rock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, like, run a perimeter, do any recon, anything else?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like there could be any other entrances?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you'd have to go around the entire mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long would it take if I flew around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, maybe at full speed, hour and a half, two hours?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck that, death first, open the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, cool cool cool, let's just shape the boulder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I want to scry on the inside, or are we just going in? Do I want to scry and see if she's there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This accounts for you flying, stopping, checking, flying, stopping, checking. You can't just check for traps while going by at 50 feet around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scrying on the inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you gonna scry?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we just going in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're doing it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we'll just go in. I mean, what are we gonna see that's gonna make us change our mind?

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if she's not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh, I'm gonna try to detect dragons! What the fuck?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's better!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I sit down and go, hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have a headache too? Oh my god, we're all gonna die. I'm patient zero.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If I'm up by the boulder, too, I will do-- I don't have a huge range, but I will do Divine Sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I can detect all manner of stuff up to 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can. All righty. So, using your Divine Sense, let's see here. Okay, so you spend your time just focusing, making sure there's nothing either in or in the immediate vicinity of the rock boulder that could be of celestial, fiend, or undead nature. While you spend a spell slot to do your Primeval Awareness. So yes, you do sense what appear to be three sources of dragon life force within the space. Roughly in the direction of this mountain and below.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (hyperventilates) They're here, she's still here, and I think the eggs are okay, 'cause I can still feel like there's dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, they're still alive?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God damn it. God. Okay. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just did it within a mile, so is that okay? Was that within a mile?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe it's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or did I need to spend longer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For that one, it is for one minute per level of the spell. And it's within one mile, up to six miles if you're in your favored terrain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so I am, because it's woods, right? Wooded?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you know at least they're within a mile.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's big.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's huge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So this is happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does anyone need to do anything else before we go in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have to go take a poo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Was that in character?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's both?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so nervous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Little bit of both.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's the plan, guys?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're gonna go in? Let's go in!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does anyone need to do a thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I don't know if we're gonna have to go through. And it only lasts for a minute, so I feel like we're gonna be in the caves longer than--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we're still stealthing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, actually, can I pull Vex aside real quick? Can I talk to you just real fast before we--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, like a little further away, like in private?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog. I'm already seeing someone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Horse? Cow? I hate to beat a dead cow, but I really did like that little magic thing I found.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What little magic thing, darling?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When we were looting and stuff? And I've been really worried about you. I know you like to bargain, right? So I thought I could trade you back for what I found. And I have this little Parapet of Wound Closure, you've been dying so much, right? And if you wear this and you die, you immediately stabilize on your next turn. I figured it'd be a good trade.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I have to attune to that, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're lying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a big word. I don't really know what you're saying. I really liked it. I mean, it made a magic sword when I touched it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, and then it gave you a headache!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but I can deal with a headache. I won't-- I just, I found it, you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog. (yells) Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is awful. No, it's so bad for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, you won't die, you won't die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) You motherfucker.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's only 'cause I'm looking out for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's the wedding all over again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You see how hard this is when people want their boots back, when people want their decks back...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't compare the boots to the deck, are you kidding me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You did find it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically, it's somebody else's.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you care what he says?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's all you can do. You can't look at anything, you have to keep it in its little pouch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, I don't look at anything, I keep it in its little pouch, I don't pull anything. I promise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, you know in Guardians of the Galaxy, when he gives him that little ball at the end?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I do that? Can I give him a pouch? Here's your cards back. But don't look at them, Grog. They're really dangerous. All right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to trade?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, give me the necklace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, there. I take the cards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So what are you giving him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little pouch that's the shape of the deck of cards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you make the pouch the shape of cards?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's maybe not that good of a pouch, but it's Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight-of-hand check with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aw, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, everybody saw through it immediately, just so you know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, obviously! But it's Grog. That's really bad. He's gonna be able to tell. Nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a perception check, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The trade is complete. She hands you your deck of cards, she takes her Parapet of Wound Closure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, I'm in so much trouble! (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you pull the right card, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you saved the party, but your marriage is in jeopardy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really good that he's sitting over at the other table right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna get the wrath of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, we have him!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can feel the heat emanating right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, feeling satisfied that your imploring of Vex and a trade you've made, your shiny package of happy cards are back in your possession, but you promised, at the moment, at least--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To not look at them. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While she's right there in front of you, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, Vex. That really means the world.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously, though, they're really, really dangerous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, they're really special. I won't look at them or anything. That means a lot. I don't find a lot of great things. I did find a couple rocks, earlier, if you want them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, they're yours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Are you sure? You're not gonna try and steal that shit, too?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I promise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He looks happy. What was that about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (nervous laughter) Oh, I just gave him back his cards, is all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So happy to be reunited.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so proud of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. What are the rest of you doing in the meantime?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've got a little bead of sweat on your forehead, Vex. It's such a humid jungle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We zoom in on the single drop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm waiting to sculpt a hole in the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, using Stone Shape, you can-- a section of stone no more than five feet in any dimension, and form in any shape that suits your purpose. So. You can make a small passage, as long as it is no more than five feet thick. The wall and the stone are both thicker than five feet. You can begin to make a slight passageway. You can create enough of a crack with your spell, as it completes, which, mark off your 4th-level spell, but as you create it, you do manage to pierce, and you can look into the darkness of the tunnel behind, but through the full use of the spell, you create this kind of tunnel intrusion into the side of this mountain, and you only get that much of opening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, this is an excellent start.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. In spelunker-Keyleth mode, I'm looking through the hole with my Darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do I see?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fanart, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth in The Descent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, son of a bitch! That's a one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you see, Keyleth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just got James Franco'd.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so fucking dark, you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about I try-- Oh! What if we light an arrow, can I do an Oracle Arrow through the hole?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I shimmy out and say, Vex, go in the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. So you pull back the arrow, you fire it through. The arrow-- go ahead and make an attack roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm getting death looks. Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a layer of untouched dust all across the ground, and interesting texture the further in you go. And then eventually, about 100 feet or so in, the tunnel begins to curve to the left and descend before the arrow lands and sticks into the rock there, splintering a little bit, and your vision now sits there with the arrow. There doesn't appear to be any movement. It is silent and pitch-black.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was just heavy dust.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you could see from the arrow rushing past it, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that gap is just this much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about that big, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And does it go in like that, like a long tunnel of that, or is it-- could I reach my arm through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, it's like the edge of the wall of this tunnel and the rock were kind of jammed together, and she punched through just enough to push past where the rock and the wall had hit, and it created this slight opening, but there's still a bunch of stone there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay, there's options.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I shimmy out. It's just a tunnel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's a long tunnel.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That means we could make a little bit of noise getting in here, maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Potentially. Raishan, I think, has rather good hearing. If we make a lot of noise, it might echo down.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have no way of keeping silent, do we? We don't have any way of--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could try, like what you said. I can always, worst-case scenario, burn another 4th-level to finish this off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For a door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've spent more opening a door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't have to spend anything. I'll just beat the shit out of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're our last resort at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you do have siege gauntlets, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why do you say that right now? How is that relevant to the conversation at hand?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They work for me, they speak to me. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've always said as much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a relationship with all of your inanimate objects?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I try to work on it at night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, I actually do blame myself for this. This is interesting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why would you say that, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, I feel like there's a lot of secrets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think? Should we burn another 4th, or should we have Grog punch the little hole a little bit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, let me see. I crawl back in the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know how, like, a blade of grass can break a block of concrete?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Go with me. Okay. You know how plants can break stone when they grow through? If I do a Druidcraft cantrip and try and grow some plants through this hole, will it maybe help crack open a bigger hole?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you fast-forward 1000 years?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (creeper hissing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog. You wanna go punch some shit?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Hold on for one second.
