I know you can move this stone, if it allows you to only move certain parts of it, could you use the stone you can shape to effectively carve out a chunk that could be pulled out? Like a very thin, narrow, like just move as much as a finger's-width around and then we could pull that out instead of just pushing it all the way like clay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, it could be, but one spell's already been spent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it would just be another spell slot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it would work.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It would be another spell, but that would be just two to get in, as opposed to endlessly throwing spell after spell at this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, Grog has siege gauntlets, so he could potentially do some damage to the rock, but it would make noise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One second. Percy. I have a nutball idea that maybe you could turn into a better one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doors!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out the Oil of Etherealness that I've been carrying for ages.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The What of Whatness?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I can't do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's not enough to cover me. But Scanlan could do it or Pike could do it and could walk through the rock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then do what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look around, see if there's anything to-- I don't know. I prefaced it with saying it was a shitty idea, and I spoke to the brain to see if he could come up with something better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We looked for a switch, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a giant rock. It's a boulder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With handholds on it. It's Fortress of Solitude.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I look for a switch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I solve this... 19. Oh, minus... 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Looking around as they're having this conversation, there's no switches, but you do see fingerholds, like big, dragon-sized fingerholds, like something grabbed it and jammed this boulder in there.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I actually want to kind of take a look around, too, because if this is a naturally formed rock, a naturally formed opening, this is not like a cork in a bottle. There has to be some parts that don't fit really smoothly. Have we found the best place to make our incursion? Is there an opening? Is there any-- this can't fit snugly into this unless it's been shaped for that purpose.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can now get enough of a hold to make a lever and move the boulder out a little bit, get us all in, and then drop it back into place. In theory. We have this hole now that's big enough for, let's say, a magical weapon that can't be destroyed? And we can just apply as much pressure, put a bunch of other people pushing on the other side and see if we can open it up enough to get in and then let it close behind us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How would Bigby be in this situation?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bigby would be an upper-level spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't want to burn that right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog. Do you want to try and use some of your basic mechanics of physics? Of leveraging?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what that is, but I will assault this stone with a quickness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it! Just get us in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't assault it. Don't insul-- don't insult or assault it. If you could just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no joy in either of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I know. This one isn't for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who's got a magical weapon that's very long?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kima.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you could take Kima's sword, pry open a crack, let us slip in--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ask Kima for the Holy Avenger, I'm not taking that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, don't you have the dragon sword?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ask Kima for her sword. See how that goes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Kima.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're thinking about building a giant lever. Could you put your sword in that hole and help us pull very, very hard to see if we can move this boulder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Will it damage the sword?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In theory, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In theory.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a magical sword. Can you break a magical sword with pressure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You ding it, you pay."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair. So I'm going to try and build this lever. All of us are going to put pressure in the other direction, we're going to try and have as many of us moving this thing just a couple feet. Not far. Just far enough to make an opening to get as many of us through as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so who's doing the leverage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike is.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Definitely Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, well, the size of the sword, at most it's going to be one person assisting the main person. Which would be Pike assisting Grog. All right. So as the rest of you guys get on the other side, Grog, I want you to go ahead and roll a strength check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike and Grog, Pike and Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage because of Pike's aid on this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank god. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the large rock, the boulder begins to shift ever-so-slightly. You watch as dust and other small pebbles begin to clatter down the outside of the rock. You all get on the other side and, all together as a group, everyone else make strength checks.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: We can use the rod of immobility to brace it if we need to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's a good call, because we have two of them, now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's such a good idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have holes drilled in the stone by dragon feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good call, you guys. Wait, we're all doing a strength check?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just straight strength?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Straight strength, so add your strength modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you want Pike's?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To do what, help prop it up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan rolled a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Okay. So you manage to get about a foot and a half--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket rolled a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There isn't a whole lot of surface area here to really aid, it's mostly on you, Grog, and you manage to get about a foot and a half wide before you pull out the Immovable Rods and Kerrek, and anybody else who wants to help, you manage to jam them into two of the finger-holes, and as soon as they lock in, you can release the weapon and it's just enough to hold it in place, although it is slowly moving. Each rod can only hold 8,000 pounds. Mind you, it's not holding it entirely aloft, it seems to be holding okay for now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I immediately throw Whisper through the crack and bamf through.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I scootch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I scootch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all pull through. Kima immediately rushes and grabs the sword. You guys charge into the darkness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can Trinket get in or do I need to bamf him in the necklace and bamf him out? Okay, that's what I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all do get inside the tunnel. The boulder does appear to be stationary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we leave it open, or should we take the rods? We might need to get out in a hurry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What a wonderfully convenient way to close. And it also means that the dragon will not be able to open the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because it's wedged?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's wedged shut.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She could turn into a person. She can also teleport. Let's not forget that. Okay, let's keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just, let's remember to pick those up, if there's anybody left to get them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything in here has been, at least in this portion of it, still and untouched for quite some time. As you guys push forward through this tunnel, to where it begins to make its slow descent--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys? All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Checking, checking, checking. 24.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this is investigation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought you were stealthing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, was that a stealth roll or an investigation roll? That was investigation, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was investigation. 24?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dogshit. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. We'll have to make-- we'll say, make new stealth checks since you guys have come out of stealth and you're back in. But as you guys are moving down the curvature of the tunnel, Vax, you notice that there are, amongst the dust and pebbles of the floor, small pieces and chunks of other material. Most of them very small, maybe anywhere from a pebble size to the size of this die or a little larger. And they're different than the rock, they're a lighter material, and almost porous upon close look, as you take one and look at it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know what that is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not a very thick mat, but just here and there, peppered throughout the walkway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also do notice, upon looking at a few of them on the ground, now having the context, a lot of them look blackened, a lot of them look like they've been charred, burnt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When you did the scrying thing, how long did it take to get down in the tunnels? Was it a lot of tunnels before you got to the laboratory?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In terms of my vision?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you have no idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's less than a mile down, I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It kind of rushes past you really fast, it's a little disorienting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No traps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No traps at the moment, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we all stealth?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: These are just here so that people step on them and it makes noise?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a theory. We already stealthed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we had to reroll stealth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a-- this is some CSI shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are going stealth, right? All right, so roll your stealth checks, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus ten?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 34. And then Scanlan...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 30 total.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 25 for Pike.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, sorry. Oh, 30.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 18 for Scanlan.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: 29 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great, awesome. All right, so, as you guys continue progressing down this curving tunnel, it goes into a very, very mild descent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do-- I wanna do a quick check. This is some Bones-type shit. Can I see if these bones were charred recently, or once again, if these bones have been there for a long time? I know this is some weird carbon-dating shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check on this, actually. This is your understanding at least of how fire against bone, which is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good. 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. Yeah, so understanding especially in the Pyrah, and noticing the difference and just your experience of natural animals and creatures that have been cooked to be eaten, and the effect of the fire on the bones that are left behind, this bone charring is not as ancient as, say, the trees that have withered, but they're aren't-- they're years old at the very least, if not longer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Years old, if not longer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's a layer of dust on these bones, as well, that shows that at least they have been untouched for a short time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. But wait, was Thordak here over a year ago?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could have been, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was here for a long time before-- he was here before he got the thing, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. He made this his lair after avoiding death from J'mon Sa Ord in Ank'harel, and then recuperated here, from what you know, and then made this his domain for a while, and then pressed northward in Tal'Dorei, which is where--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's when Allura and her team encountered him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. That's when Thordak battled Raishan and began the beginning of the formulation of the Conclave, that's when Thordak destroyed Byroden and by proxy, their mother. That's when all of that went down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While we're quiet here, in the dark, I pull Pike over to the side. Pike!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a bad-- will you take care of my sister? You have that one thing that you do, I don't know what it's called, but if she falls down, she gets back up again. Do you know what I'm talking about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that the Death Ward? It's a thing. I talk to Sarenrae and then she protects them for a little bit of time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you do that to my sister now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, if you want me to do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do, I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, why not? I walk up to me. I guess Pike will cast Death Ward on Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So that's a 4th-level spell off Pike, and for the next eight hours, Vex is Death Warded.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you're brought down to zero, you ping up to one, is the math on that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's kind of like buying Starbucks with the company Amex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Feels a little weird, not gonna lie.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's done, and my sister is a little safer than she was before, and y'all can go fuck yourselves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one and this one on me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's totally cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Out of character, Matt pooped out this new feature to dying, and she's on her last fucking string, man. No regrets, move forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To be fair, I'm still toying with it, because it's one of the things that I'm adjusting as we go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you said it and the spell is cast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's not true at all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You freaked everyone out, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I can keep it if you want.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, don't worry about it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're literally wearing a creeper shirt, you have to be careful what you say. God, every time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a rule that I'm working with. I may have jumped the gun in releasing it at the time as I'm working on the campaign guide, but one of the resurrection rules, I was deciding the DC, I think five per death is a bit intense, so I might adjust it more to be a two. Just 'cause I was thinking, in a long-term campaign, your character might die a lot more between levels one and 20. And then it gets a little insane. So I'm working on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Listen, I help my sister, okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mind you, she's still closer to death, but yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mind you, she's still closer to death.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Just to ask a little bit, as we're going down here, I don't know how everyone else is geared up, but I'm kind of vanilla human here, and not that equipped to see in the dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, in fact, currently Percival and Kerrek are blind. Like, pitch-black blind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, light your little dagger up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Actually, you probably just hear Kerrek say, I am sorry, but at this point I can't see at all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm always holding two, and one of them is, I pull out the Flametongue Dagger, and I wave a fly away--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This gnat, this fucking gnat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I hold it so that Kerrek can see, and I say, we might die, so try it one more time with me. Irish wristwatch. Just once more, before we die.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a tough one.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Well done.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel so much closer to you now. Let's fucking do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dagger, which emits flame on it, is the equivalent of a candle. He can see about 15 feet beyond you, and that's it.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well, actually, I'll say, as soon as I say, are we okay with light? Or are we trying to keep it as dark as possible? Because--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Too late now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little bit of light.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a candle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is now a flame licking the edge of the blade that's being held aloft. So light is being shed now in the tunnel. Though not a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, you could put that out and they could just grab onto each one of our arms and move forward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I go and find Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I link arms.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, jeez. Hey, Kerr, you wanna cuddle?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Vax. Put that light out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heavy footfalls approaching you as suddenly a large, muscled, somewhat sweaty arm just curls around the outside of your shoulders and pulls you close to Grog's torso.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love it. I love it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're about to die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I kinda guide Percy as we go through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys are making your way down this slow grade beneath. Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Being stealthy as fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, as the grade continues downward, you begin to see the hallway open up ever-so-slightly, and what was once just somewhat rough rock walls begin having slight shapes or details to them. It's still hard to see. Darkvision is-- you still need a little light to make out fine details or things at a distance, but it does help you at least make out the basic shapes and things ahead of you. You see what appear to be small shelves or alcoves that are now beginning to show up every 20 or so feet as you progress down. Little bits of rock that jut out that look like they were either bolted in or crafted on top of it, and you see small, little cubbies, almost, little alcoves that are put into the rock as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold your little dagger up to it, I want to see what it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're sure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's pretty good. That is 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You glance in the first one to your immediate right, which is a small shelf outward, and you see what appear to be a number of dust-covered-- a cluster of candles that have long burned and melted into dripping wax that pours down the side of this alcove. That's it on that particular shelf.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Careful. Maybe keep it out, just keep an eye out. It's hard to see down here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can look at these after.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I just, I mean for traps. Psh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you're searching for traps now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Constantly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make another investigation check with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 'Cause it's dark. See? If you'd pulled your dagger out, it wouldn't be so bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good suggestion. Still at disadvantage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If his dagger's out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me double-check, here. It's kind of a frustratingly broken ability in some cases if it just is universally in here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) And I'm gonna walk over to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light, so you have about 15 feet you can kind of see out in front of you in straight darkness. If you have your dagger out, you can see pretty decently for 60 feet, is how it works.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But if it's gone, I can see 15 feet ahead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kinda shitty in 15 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna give the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So regular checks, if the dagger's out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For, at least, 60 feet for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And this is investigation. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue pushing forward, you see one more of these shelves. Are you looking at each one as you go?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, right now I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you glance past, another perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Grog. So I have this flying carpet...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Okay. You can see on the left shelf appears to be a humanoid skull that's up on top, next to two more candles, one of them more melted than the other, but the wax drips past. There's a shelf across the way on the opposite side that appears to have a couple of small books that are put off to the side, and what looks like a small wooden box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is the box trapped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Box does not appear trapped, from what you can tell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nah, fuck it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Put it in the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, continue walking?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mm-hm. Looking for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not taxidermied, by any means. It just looks like it dried out in a sort of standing position, or at least is leaning against the wall of the platform.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, like some weird Pompeii shit? Like he died that way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of. Literally just shriveled.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, would you be able to use a flying carpet in battle to get up to a dragon?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have no idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be useful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kerrek, do you have something you wanted to say?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, I'm just gonna-- blind as a bat as I am, I'm gonna use Divine Sense to see if I can sense any undead, corrupt, fiend, it's kind of a long list, but I do know corrupt was mentioned in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also, Vax, what were the titles of those books? Earpiece, listening to your vague description of things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you for retconning that. Yeah, we'll ask him. Yeah, but I would've read them if I could've. I'm not Grog.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grog would've read them, even if he just made up words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do sense that there is some sort of an undead presence in your vicinity, Kerr, though you do not quite know what its nature is or its direction. There is something undead near you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, jeez. She didn't bring Thordak back, did she? We're gonna have to fight an undead dragon.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Everybody bumps into skeletons early in their career.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. I would say it does not appear to be any extreme-- yeah, it does not appear to be an extremely powerful undead presence. You can't tell size or direction, by any means, but it's not like all of a sudden there's a lich ahead of you or some massive arrival of Orcus. You just sense something around you that is an undead energy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Around us? Like how close around us, can he sense that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, this could be crypt shit on the sides. I'm gonna focus a little more on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, do you guys all continue moving forward?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did ask about the books, the titles of the books.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could I read them when I saw them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What languages do you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Common, Elvish, and Abyssal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not know the title of the books.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tighter Buns in 30 Days is the only title I saw. Looking for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Roll another investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no trap set. You do look ahead and see what appears to be the pathway is now showing stonework at times, almost like there are slabs, elements of a tunnel that was once better constructed than what exists, but is either eroded away or elements of wall collapse have covered what was once a very, very ancient form of architecture.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As a precaution, I'm going to, as much as I can, stay to the stuff that looks natural or fucked-up and not civilized.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Hold on, first, I'm sorry. I just found my specific description. It does say I sense type and location.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does say that, I totally missed that.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: So long as it's not behind total cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got you. Okay. Then you sense there is something. You know it's from one of the wall areas, but you cannot see, and your one single bit of light source is ahead of you in the tunnel. But you do sense, at one point as you're walking, it is to the left of you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Okay. I say, there is an unclean thing here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I put my arm down off his shoulder, I'll grant him at least that.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: To my left.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The left hand of the tunnel.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: But I don't know what's around here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see anything on the walls that looks like a door or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you stopping? 'Cause you two are moving ahead of everyone else, so you guys are probably a good 15, 20 feet ahead. You want to move back with them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I look to the left, just off him saying that, because of the Belt of Dwarvenkind I have Darkvision?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. You glance off to the left. You can see upon that shelf unit there, there are the two candles and the singular skull set on the shelf.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I start to slowly make my way over to the skull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gods damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kerrek, you feel Grog slowly step in the direction that you pointed out to him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this the direction?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we getting warmer?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yes, it's over there. I'm not bringing my hammer out, but my hammer's ready.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What does the skull look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like a human skull.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything shiny about it, or jewelled?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it looks kind of dust-covered. You can see what looks to be-- the bone itself appears to have a hint of blackened soot, or some sort of a darker color to it, like it's been slightly singed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Candles look like candles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Candles look like mostly melted candles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kerr, I hate to rain on your parade, but I only see two candles and a human skull up here.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Partial undead thing... do I know, again, obviously nothing is trying to eat our faces off here, but can you turn an undead thing into just like a watcher or a trap or a spy or a trigger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check, or make a religion check. Make a religion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're brilliant, Kerr! Fuck.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You know, that's about a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Not my best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best that you can understand is, undead magic can raise dead, it can control dead. You have heard stories of undead or the use of them being more situational, as opposed to just roaming as zombies, but that's as much as you can call off the top of your head. It's been a while since you've been adventuring, so the specific stories are a little too foggy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it could be a security camera.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Actually, I say, if there's-- give me the skull. And I'm just reaching out blindly in his direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I grab the skull and hand it to Kerr.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And then I'll use Divine Sense again. Is it this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is, the skull is the source of the undead energy. It is not currently moving or reacting or having any sort of reaction to being held by you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I say, anybody mind if I wreck this thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I do not mind at all, thank god there's someone else in this world with my sort of thinking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you doing back there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold on. I grab my earring, and I say, Kerr found a human skull that has some undead vibes vibrating out of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But it's not doing anything. Do you mind if we destroy it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's already holding it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I mean, if anything was gonna happen, we're probably fucked already, so I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, where's Kima?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a good point. What is your guys' marching order, by the way? I know the twins are in the front.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then I think it's you and Kerr, and then me and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog and Kerr, Keyleth and Percy--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ash and Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ash and Scanlan after that. And then we have-- do you have Trinket out of the necklace, right? Then probably Kima and Allura back with Trinket in the back. So they're kind of holding up the rear and keeping an eye out behind as they go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think destroying it will trigger it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm kind of for leaving things alone as we go through here, Percival.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, we can leave it alone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could do Sacred Flame on it, and it would do radiant damage to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we turn and just face the skull so it's looking into the corner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's not looking at us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think dicking with it in the first place might have already ruined us, but yeah, let's just set it down, turn it around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Kerr, they're worried we're gonna kill ourselves. Can you just put it back, but face it towards the wall like it's in time out?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Sure. If I've got a spare sack, I'll stuff it in the sack and point it towards the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you pull out the extra, kind of a heavy burlap sack, you throw the skull in there, tie it taut, and set it back up on the shelf, facing away from where you're standing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do not underestimate the power of burlap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should've come down in the tunnel wearing pantyhose on our heads so Raishan wouldn't have known.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just thought it was a college prank?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man, we should totally invest in those little pantyhose eggs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Delta lambda again, sneaking in, aw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every time!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know enough about that to say that correctly, either.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing onward, into the next length of the tunnel, about another 50 feet or so, there is-- the room opens up, and you can see that stonework eventually takes the entire floor, and the chamber opens up into what looks to be almost like a hexagonal-shaped chamber that ends at a large iron door. It fills the entirety of the chamber, and it seals off any progression from that point. Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vex-agonal shaped.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vex-agonal? Should I make a perception check, too, since I'm near it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, that was almost a one. But it's not, it was a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So 15 total? Okay. As you glance, you can see at the center of this chamber there looks to be-- let's see here. Okay, yeah. There stands a pillar of dark green marble, about ten feet, 15 feet away from where the iron door is, and what looks to be a roughly forged bowl of iron that is imperfect and is bolted to the top of this pillar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On the top or out the side of the top?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Resting on top of it, and it's about maybe five, six feet up, and there is a platform that leads up to it. So maybe if you were standing on the little dais around it, it'd be about chest-height to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How tall is this chamber?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The chamber's whole height would be about 25 feet. You also see, off to the right, what appears to be another shelf that contains a very, very large leather-bound tome and what looks to be a cold iron brazier that is unburnt but has a bunch of dried tinder in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, come here, come here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's some shit, there's some ingredients in that, ready to go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's ingredients?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, there's something in that brazier over there that she hasn't burned yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I get a little light in here, just for a second?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a tiny bit of candlelight. You can see about ten, 15 feet around Vax.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so I can't see the mechanism on the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not even know there's a door there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's fair. For the best, it would just scare me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, would it be helpful if everyone could see?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Take a look around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one else is in this room, yeah? Can the half-elves with Darkvision do a little--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make perception checks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll do that, and I'm also going to do Divine Sense here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil. Oh, thanks, Gil! That's not bad! Perception, right? 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There does not appear to be anybody else in this chamber with you, and from your Divine Sense, you do not sense any undead within 60 feet of you right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no undead dragons walking around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I look for invisible dragons? No, I'm kidding.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You see seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, Light? Should we light it up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't sense any undead within 60 feet, that's the range of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right. How far from the gate to the far side of the room, is the first question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The doorway, you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm at a gate that blocks us from going in, is that correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're entering this chamber, then on the opposite side of the room there is a larger door that prevents you from progressing beyond the doorway. In between you and that door, there is that raised platform, the pillar, and the iron bowl, and then to the right and against the wall, there is the brazier and the shelf with the singular tome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like-- when we entered the chamber, does it look like a door would come down or something when it opened up into the chamber?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, is there a gap, like a crack that something could slide down out of right above where we are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing up, based on your perception rolls, you don't see anything that would dictate any sort of exit or entranceway from the ceiling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And in addition to everything we see, do we see levers, do we see panels, do we see anything on the walls in this room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there's standard stone, old stone masonry. You can see chunks that have broken off and just fallen over the years, there's a couple small cave-in areas where it looks like rocks have just tumbled in as the general shifting of the island has caused some elements to fall loose and tumble in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth is gonna go ahead and light up her fire hands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That gives a bigger radius. Comparable torchlight to Keyleth, and now Kerrek and Percival, you guys can both have a much better view of the room. You can see now this iron bowl on top of this pillar in the center. You can just make out the large iron wall or door on the opposite side, and a little bit of the brazier and the tome.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've built a fire-lock mechanism for a door before. Would I recognize this as being a set a fire in the bowl and that might open the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I built one for the Raven Queen temple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go Percy, go Percy, go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Intelligence check? That's, with my new intelligence level, that's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. Best you can glance here, I mean, it's possible, but this--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. The room itself is ancient, and the construction, there is nothing that appears to be mechanically attached.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So if it did, it would be magical. If that was--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's no chain, pulley system visible at all. Where the door hits the seam of the room, it looks very smooth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I go look in the bowl, the bowl in the middle of the room, and just look and see if there's a residue of anything in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, you can make an investigation check.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Can I just say that when the lights came up, Kerr kind of, he'd been leaning into Grog maybe more than was entirely appropriate. So he kind of stood up a little better on his own to get out of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. (clears throat)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Luckily, no one saw you, because of that robe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look down into the bowl, you can make out what looks to be a very, very faint long-dried residue just at the very, very bottom of it. Some sort of a liquid that was once in there that has since dried up entirely and left this very, very faint, just a slight shift in texture other than the hammered iron.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No color change or anything on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not that you can really tell, no. You're just looking into this dark bowl with a little bit of light source.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I don't actually touch it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have something sharp to just scrape some off?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While she's doing that, I'm just going to quietly extend my wings now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your wings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, I get out a lockpick and scrape it to see if I can--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Holy shit! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're pretty cool, aren't they.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They take up a lot of room, though, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, they don't. They go out and they slam back into my back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Kerrek, as they're having this conversation, you're looking, watching as this small half-elf rogue that you've had a few encounters with suddenly just sends this pair of large jet-black raven-like wings that fire from his shoulderblades and slowly fold behind him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They don't work. He just does that to be an asshole.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's all a cosplay prop. That's all it is.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Strikes a bit of a figure, though, doesn't he?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it's very attractive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I heard Percival say that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scratch-scratch, scrape-scrape.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're scraping the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, just to see what the residue is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it scrapes up, it creates a small, almost like a dried powder-type substance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What color is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a dark burgundy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is fucking blood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I taste it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, taste it, has kind of an iron-like taste.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it's so blood. Oh, you're so right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should just bleed into this bowl and the door will open.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tempting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Necromancy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that's the word, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is the book's language, what does it look like? I'm not picking it up yet, I'm just looking at it on the shelf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's like a tome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it made of skin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, do you want to go over and check it out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It appears to be a thick leather. It's hard to tell in this light if it was made from tanned hide or tanned flesh, but it is old.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As we're watching Grog, I just lean over and say, you know, you are criticizing the size of my wings, you are walking around with a Persian rug, a broom, and a longbow strapped to your back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tried to give this rug to someone else, but Grog didn't want to take it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I come up and I say, can I pet your wings? I've never pet them before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's things going on in this room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hear this heavy sigh from Allura behind you, she's like, (sighs). "I'm just, this "is my first time actually adventuring with you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is our method.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to see if we put the PDA in the bowl, see if that'll--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, don't get me wrong, it just reminds me of my early days as an adventurer, and I forgot "just how ridiculous we were, so."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there still tinder under the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's the iron brazier and there's a lot of dried-- inside there, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we do have samples of blood, in theory, in the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (feedback sound)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, jeez.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've caused a feedback loop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's coming!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are Spinal Tap!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put the dragon blood away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any holes in the ceiling I can see like there were in the last cave?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have this ringing in my ear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There do not appear to be holes in the ceiling, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What should I do? Wait, I've also got other kinds of blood, let me see what kinds of blood I've got.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is the book trapped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24? Looking at the book, are you taking it off the shelf or are you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm looking at it, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at it. It looks like it is just resting against the wall. The shelf unit is not trapped, the book itself does not appear to have any sort of connection to the wall, you can see the pages themselves are weathered, old, stained, but intact.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is anyone near me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, Percival's a step or two behind you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm holding onto the wing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I push back slowly with my wings. Just get 15, 20 behind me. I'm gonna bring it to you. I'm gonna try to take this fucking book off, okay? If I'm going to go down, I don't want you to go down as well, all right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you about to die right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love you! I know your name on my good days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (chanting) Grab it, grab it, grab it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I get back about ten feet and I take my wing and I scootch it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, you know what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're saying this, the book (impact) and hits the ground. It scatters open.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it's open? Percival, come here. And I light it up, just to look at the pages that are there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take the dagger and you place it over there. You don't recognize the text. And you try and focus on it, too, and you don't recognize it, either. It's like the more you look at the text, the text gets smaller and smaller and smaller until it's microscopic. It just looks like a mess of symbols and details. It's weird, it's almost like as you get closer, the perspective keeps shifting away from you, to where you cannot actually make out or read the text in the book.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How's it feel?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna flip gently, with a gloved hand, flip through a couple pages just to see if it's text, text, text, or if there's any--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As of right now, it looks like there's just text. As you go through, every page seems to have the same sort of reaction, where as your eyes try and focus in the low light, the text just gets smaller and smaller and just avoid comprehension.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to flip to the front really quickly and see if there's a title.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a title, and as you look at it, the title itself seems to be blurred and obscured and begins to shrink as well. It's like trying to put on a pair of reading glasses that won't focus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know that feeling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Allura, will you have a look at this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She comes over. Kerr, what are you doing?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll actually bring out my hammer and, assuming that I can get close to the book as well, it does the same thing for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get close and look, yes, the same thing, your vision doesn't seem to focus on the text, the pages seem to just hide from--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I was going to say, are we okay with more light?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Kind of looking around. Okay. Then I'll effectively, I'll activate the hammer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As he pulls his warhammer in front of him, you watch as the head of it, the spike in the back--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: There is no head, it's just kind of a bar of iron that he has until he holds it up, and then the head of it comes into being as an artifact of radiant light.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what would've been the back of the hammer, the front of it is, like you said, missing entirely, and it just blazes forth with radiant energy, like a giant, glowing metallic end of a weapon.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'd also like to think that it makes a noise like a lightsaber, but that's just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (lightsaber sound) as it happens. The room is now much brighter, and you can see the details of the stonework around you. The mustiness seems to almost back away instinctually from the radiant light itself, almost warms the air in its vicinity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It smells like strawberries!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's very weird strawberries, probably. As the light hits the pages, the pages go almost blank. The text just shrinks away to the point where it looks like there's just tiny, tiny dots.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I've solved this!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's extinguish all the lights, and someone with low-light vision has to read it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. That's not funny.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, sure, yeah, extinguish all the lights. I wanna go and see if I can read it.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Switch off the hammer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The head of the warhammer flickers out, leaving just the handle behind. You go ahead and look at it, and the text is more legible there on the page, but it's still blurred to your vision.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I need glasses. It's blurry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have anybody with perfect nightvision?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Perfect nightvision?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: 20-20 nightvision?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I can't see a thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing, for you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nah, it's blurry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe, I don't know, anything? I know Primordial.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Might be that we're too nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe if you put something in the pot and set it on fire, by that light, you'll--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan goes up and looks at it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Begrudgingly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, guys!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we figured something out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should light the brazier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should light the brazier. That, or raid the cabinets we passed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura, who's-- oh, so you're going to light the brazier with your hand?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're bringing the light back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so the room fills with light once more. Kerrek, you can bring your hammer back if you'd like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're basically all running around the room in circles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys are just charging around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we gonna light this brazier? Keyleth goes up and just sticks her flaming hand right down into the middle of the brazier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Your hand hits the top of the kindling, at which point the wood catches, and there's a slight flash as the extremely explosive materials that were within the brazier detonate, causing Percival, Allura, Vex, and Vax, who were also reading the book nearby, to all have to make a dexterity saving throw. As there's a sudden (explosion). It explodes with a force.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I make a dexterity save as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't make it, you just take the damage, since you were at ground zero.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's fair.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: To be fair, I was right next to the book as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. So you go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw as well, Kerrek.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16 and a Luck blown.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kerrek, what'd you get?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I got a three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, Kerr!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you take 16. You take none because you're a rogue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I start breakdancing, doing the worm underneath the blast. Jeez, all right. The Luck wasn't blown, because the other roll was a one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog! Did you see that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did, but everything's really, really bright right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your ears are ringing from the blast of the impact, the brazier's just, all the metal's just bent outward and ruined.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've just got the lit-up shapes of a bunch of people going like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's like a cartoon character.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This has happened to me dozens of times.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If Raishan didn't hear us before, she potentially heard us now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At least now we don't have to try and stealth anymore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) Is the door open? I'm sorry if I'm speaking loudly! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door is not open.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) The door is not open?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need blood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The book's fine, I assume?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The book has burned entirely. It is destroyed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who cares about books?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see Allura, who made the save but took some damage, is at the back and is kind of chuckling to herself, goes, "Well, I think now we know the purpose of the book."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that dick book.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No fucking way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was well-played, and curse be on the one who thought that up."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I recognize the smell of whatever they used to ignite that, or was it more mystical in nature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a sort of mixture of extremely flammable liquids. It was not black powder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well. Let's try and pour some of the dragon blood into the bowl and see if that does it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Opens the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's blow a vial, see what happens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dragon blood is so expensive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't we just knock it down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have basilisk blood, black dragon blood, and white dragon blood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's try basilisk and work our way up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're worth 7000 gold each.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One basilisk vial.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you uncork and let it flow, and it's thick, syrupy, it hits and it pools. A moment passes. Two moments. Nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck. I pull out my opal dagger and I just cut my hand and drip it in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The basilisk blood that's still in there, you bleed into the basilisk blood, and it pools in the center of it. And you watch as the blood that you just dropped gets pulled beneath the surface of the basilisk blood and out of sight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Creepy. Is the door opening?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the few drops of blood you put in there, it has not opened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like a kill-something sort of situation.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Kerrek is reaching out, kind of like, don't-don't-don't. There's a lot of things in the world that shouldn't have your blood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well, shit. (laughs)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Especially something clever enough to lay a trap like that. Might be clever enough to trick a bunch of people into handing over blood.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far is it to the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the pillar? About 15 feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk over to the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna go with Grog. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Punch it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I-- would you mind--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You guys work on your thing. I'm gonna work on another thing. I'm gonna go over to those other shelves, I'm gonna see what the fuck is up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go with Percy. I do that. Inspecting the shelves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna quick-jog to the other shelves and take a look at those books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door begins to shift. There's a slight shaking sensation as the bowl itself begins to glow, and the basilisk's blood begins to sizzle and burn away, almost like it's being pushed to the outer edges of the bowl with just the singular drops from your blood resting in the center. The room begins to shake a bit, and you watch as dust that had been alongside the ceiling begins to slightly cascade from above you. The metallic door lifts up and reveals the other side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Completely? It's open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's open. You do take a point of damage from the blood that you lost.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys are just starting to push out of the room. At which point, you begin to hear laughter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cackling) And you watch as, down in the distance of each side of the hallway from where you came and where you're going, these little sources of light suddenly spark up and begin drifting towards you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike immediately casts--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beacon of Hope?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no, not that. She casts the other thing. Shouldn't she? It's undead. Holy Aura on all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What does that do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fiends and undead who do melee attacks have to make a constitution save or be blinded.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Flaming skulls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Flaming skulls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Flame-wreathed skulls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just floating towards you. You get the sense that one of these may have, at one point, been contained within a bag.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're gonna be fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Firecracker outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. We'll be back here in a few minutes. We're going to go ahead and take a restroom break, and we'll see where this next chapter is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you all to roll initiative, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sings) Get it on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) It's the Kiss army.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While they're rolling their initiatives, we had a winner in the chatroom for a Wyrmwood Zebrawood complete dice tower system right here, as well as this awesome leather thing from Wyrmwood, here, they have this nice leather band as well. The winner is heartman_, by the way, congratulations, heartman_.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think you have Zebrawood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Zebrawood is, I believe, the one that I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Delightful. So congratulations, we'll get this to you ASAP. All righty. So. Getting initiative scores here from people. 25 to 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, we're rolling initiative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck me. That's cocked. Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why can't I have these when it really makes sense?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 22 total.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 22 for Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whoa! Scanlan's always in the rear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He rolled a natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me and Scanlan, nat-20 brothers! For Scanlan who's not here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 20 to 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16 for Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, Vex. 15 to ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Just out of curiosity, do you allow people to delay their action to act later in the turn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hold an action, meaning you still take your turn, you still move, but you can hold your action for a trigger. So like, I will hold my action to attack if something comes in range. Or I can hold my action to cast a spell when a certain creature does something. But you still take your turn, you don't move the turn order.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What'd Pike roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike rolled a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike at the end. Kerrek, what'd you get?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: A one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, Kerr.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Number one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who rolled one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kerr.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay. You and Kima are down there. All right, so.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: The term is anchor-man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, at the top of the round, as these skulls are beginning to find their way in towards the cavern towards you, as you've all circled around Pike in the center of this chamber here, I would like Scanlan and Vax to go first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. After you, Scanman.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can turn myself invisible? It's a level three spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna turn invisible and back up against the northern wall in the corner and see if the skulls notice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So Scanlan is gonna go invisible and back up here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a 2nd-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. 2nd level.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm going to hold my action until I find out whether or not-- oh, invisible is my action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Casting the spell is your action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm gonna back up, and yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So that's your turn. Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you point to where I am in that scrum? I can't tell. I'm going to move to the opposite wall that Scanlan just went to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So over here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and I'll fly ten feet-- I'm winged, so I'll be ten feet in the air as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I'll put you up on here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm gonna huck a pair of daggers at-- I hope this is the right way-- the one on this side that's closest to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right here. Okay, go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's shit. And then the second one--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, don't write it off, it was 15, that first one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's true, it's a 15 and then a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey! All right, so first one is with Whisper. That is four plus eight is 12, plus psychic damage, which is 19 for the first hit. And from the venom dagger that I'm throwing next, that is four plus six is ten. Ten total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 19 points of damage total. Awesome. That end your turn?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the end of my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That brings us to Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh dear god, I knew you were gonna say that. Hang on, hang on, I'm looking up the parameters of the spell. Let me see. L-M-N-O--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happened when he hit 'em with those daggers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As both these daggers slam into the skull, you watch as the flames themselves that are kind of wreathing around them, the skull just ducks out of the way, but the blade still catches and scrapes across the side of the bone, and it has to right itself, but then it gets right back into the place it was. It's taking damage, and you can see portions of the bone are starting to crack and break, but it's still, you know, still holding itself aloft.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did its little jawbone go (chattering teeth)?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet. It's not its turn yet. It's an action to chatter. I'll get you, He-Man! No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You boob!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, internet. Never change.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sings) For a revolution.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you doing for your action, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's inspiring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got inspired?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. What are you doing on your turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you stick cotton in your ears during the break?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, I got distracted. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next to Allura, and you have Kerrek to your other side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which direction were we heading?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were heading this direction. The giant gate was here, and it lifted up, and then all the skulls swarmed in from that side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's only two right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's four, there's two on this side, two on this side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: hm. Let me do this one. That guy. That make sense? So it's 120 foot, it's a concentration spell up to a minute, and it's a five-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder. It causes searing pain and takes 2d10 radiant damage after a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so constitution saving throw on each of these guys here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a five-foot radius.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you can hit one-- oh, if you hit there, you can hit 'em both.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I? Then I do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. And they-- that is a 16.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. Above average. Six plus seven is 13 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 points of damage to both of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, just a little bit of radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as the beam bursts out from the sky, you see the white radiant nature energy burst around them, and the flames seem to subside for a moment as the one that's already been damaged by Vax almost stumbles to the floor, then picks itself back up, its flame flickering more so than the allies around you. That end your turn, Keyleth? You gonna stay where you are or you gonna move?

Four of these beams in different directions here, followed by four simultaneous familiar explosions as four separate Fireballs rock the room.

lines.text: "You're too kind." And with one hand on your shoulder and her staff in the other, she thrusts it forward, and you watch as four what looks like small beads of arcane energy go rocketing out from the top of the staff, and arcing around each other, as they swell with power and force. All slam multiple times into the side, the Magic Missiles dealing five, ten, 15-- four fours in a row-- 20. Four fours in a row. And that's not quite enough to finish it.

lines.text: To each roll? Well.

lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.text: Okay, so as they're having this conversation, you push past, you don't notice anything trapped, but about 30 feet from where the iron door was, as you're scoping, the floor just turns to darkness, and as you peek over, you see now a set of stairs are descending.

As Scanlan takes the flute and takes in the fumes of the char-burned suude, the familiar burn and chemical flavor fills his lungs, and as he exhales, this fine brown smoke emits from his lungs, and his vision clarifies suddenly, and he feels this elevated sense of energy and power in his mind.
