lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's going on with the blue light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't seem to be having an effect right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just grabbed up Kerrek.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can carry Kerrek?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kerrek's pretty heavy. I need you to make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughs) Best one ever. 21.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're so strong! Oh my god! You've been lifting, bro!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a bit of a strain with the weight of his armor and getting up in his years, versus your tiny half-elf frame, but you do manage to bring him down without issue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (strained) The Raven Queen sends her regards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: This is Kerrek's best day ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Somebody's got a coupon for a back massage. Welcome to Vox Machina. You seem tense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what we pay you in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure we just killed ten minutes doing all that shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Groggy, can you come down?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it just me and Keyleth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's just the two of you up there. No, he brought Keyleth down. So it's just you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. First, I stand on the carpet. I say, lift!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The carpet takes you off the ground. You have to kinda get your--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I lay down flat. And I grab the edges of the carpet, and I go, okay! And try to go down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You go into a pseudo-nosedive. It's thrilling and scary at the same moment, and as you're going up, Grog just goes past you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stop, stop, stop!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it just barely coasts past the spikes and lets you fine on the side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's about the speed of the children's rides at Fantasyland at Disneyland, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a very big one, but not very fast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Vax does a barrel roll, heads back down, lands, and let's start looking around again. All right, stealth, traps, still vigilant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For stealth, that's a 28, and investigating for traps, ooh, that's a one, and I'm not gonna use my Luck on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not. Seems clear. We're good. I am badass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you guys have reached the bottom of this cylindrical chamber, you follow suit, one by one, which by the way, just so I know going forward, what's the marching order right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax in the front.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, baby!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, where are you at?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be behind the twins.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be behind Grog. Kerr, with Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, where are you at?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think probably, maybe Scanlan and Pike are in front of me, and then I'm probably hanging back with Kima and Allura, just sort of ready to-- I want to be at a distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Trinket's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is out now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's still in my necklace. He's healing in the necklace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, moving forward, following Vax's lead--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just gonna stay on the broom and just kind of very close to the ground, but not touching the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the hallway's probably 20 feet wide and 15 feet tall, as you push forward. The walls are chiseled rather roughly, and about 30 feet forward ahead of you, you can see it ends at a cross-section of what looks like a very deep ravine, both above and below. There is an underground chasm here that stretches both to the right and left, though you'd have to get to the very edge to kind of see how far it goes. It's about 60 feet across to the other side, and you can see what looks to be another entranceway to another hallway, and there is a taut rope bridge bolted to each side leading across.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should just use that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Totally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That looks safe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jeez, we just blew so much time on that fucking stairwell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, in Latin, Jehovah starts with an 'i'.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a leap of faith!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should've sent you to the Marx brothers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When he said 'chiseled rather roughly', he meant Brad Pitt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long until your wings stop working?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. Ten or 15, I guess?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Zoinks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zoinks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your wings went out before the battle and you took a long rest, your wings are pretty much done now. 30 minutes to an hour.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I thought we were cutting it close, like it could be five or ten minutes at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between riding everyone up and down, I'm letting you know, right now, Mr. Already Flying Everywhere, your wings are about expended.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Should I stand on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you. Do you want to keep flying until they're gone, or do you want to sit there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna fly to the other side of the bridge right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna go with him. On my broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So. You get about five feet out before the wings go (fsh).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Over nothing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking down, you see darkness, and there's a few stalagtites that--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I throw a dagger at the other side of the chasm, 60 feet, sharpshooter, into the side near the top. Whisper.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is why I went on the broom, I was gonna catch you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As an attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're attacking just the wall above, or--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a cliff facing me, right? Yeah, just into the rock wall of the cliff. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, okay. The dagger hits the edge, and you appear right at the edge of the cliff. You're gonna try to reach and grab. Make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you grab and get up on the other side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jesus! Small heart attack over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, you're floating across, and it feels strange, going across. There's no wind, but the broom is acting extremely wobbly, and the way you control it and maneuver around, you feel almost drunk, but you're not. This is not acting properly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna turn around and go back to the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you head back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was weird. It doesn't feel right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to grab on to the bridge, I'm going to test it, I'm going to step to see if it's real. I'm checking it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take your hands there, holding, and you put your foot out onto the wood, and it's sturdy. It's strong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) You bastard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up to the edge of the rope bridge that Percy's now standing on. I lean down and on the dirt I cast Druidcraft. Can I craft some vines to help reinforce the bridge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With Druidcraft, you can create some small vines that wrap around it, and it might help in some regard, but not a lot. Druidcraft is a very limited cantrip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna grab one end of the infinite rope, and I'm gonna hand the other end of the infinite rope to someone who's staying. I think that I pose a good chance of getting across this safely. I'm going to make a run for it. Well, not a run.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you literally going to run?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm going to walk. Gingerly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. So you're gonna make a walk for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm tying the rope-- That may be one of the smartest things you've ever said. I don't actually have a retort for it on any level.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know why-- what is 'retort'? Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It means if I die, you win. I'm going to tie the infinite rope to myself and hand it off to Grog. Oh god. I'm handing it to Grog. And I'm going to start gingerly stepping out onto the bridge, being very careful, and checking with each step that's it's real, and looking for weird glyphs or signs or anything out of the ordinary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy? Be careful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a dexterity check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As this happens, Scanlan sings, hey Percy, you're so fine, you're so fine you blow my mind, hey Percy! Hey Percy! Hey Percy, you're so fine, you're so fine you blow my mind, with your gun! With your gun! And then he gets a point of inspiration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you get your d12 inspiration die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Marisha, that was really nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. I feel like I had the same witty repartee as Sam Riegel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, okay, now just smile and make the smile as big as Manhattan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not bad. That's 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's really good. All right, so as you start stepping out, you feel this shift in the space, and you grab on to the edges of the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also using my boots, and I'm gluing them to whatever the-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. And as you glue the boots there, that's really what solidifies you in place, and you're still there, on the bridge, without a problem.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are things just getting weird out here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It feels weird. You can't quite understand what's transpiring, but it just feels weird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Allura. It felt like almost I was drunk as I was flying across that. Do you know--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think it's drunk, per se, it's just that you're not used to flying in that direction." And she points out towards the ravine, and you watch as Percy, who's kind of holding onto the ravine, feet solid, his hair is just up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gravity is fucked.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, this will be fine. Is gravity flipped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you hear this conversation, it seems that way, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to spider-climb. I'm just going to use my spider-climb boots, and I'm going to make my way, with the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do so. Make it across the way. The wood shivers a little bit, shifts beneath your feet, being pulled upward from your weight. You guys watch as the bridge that was once taut is now arcing up and following Percy as he moves across, his weight pulling it upward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So can I try flying out there, knowing the gravity's shifted? Does it feel okay to fly out like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you fly out and spin yourself underneath-- yes, you do actually manage to fly, essentially barrel roll across, and manage to make it across to your brother without an issue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I didn't want to go all the way across, I just wanted to test it so I could help bring other people across.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got now a third rope, we can literally just clip people to the rope, now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was like pole-dancing, but in space? Upside-down?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can use the rope we just made as a clipped rappel rope, can we? That's a thing that we can do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Potentially?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If everybody wants to try and cross, we can actually-- we now have an unencumbered piece that we can use to get people across.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm gonna jump.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no, that's a bad idea, Grog. You are very hefty and the gravity turns upside-down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's probably spikes up there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, did you see how I barrel-rolled on my broom?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, do I twist in the air?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you should just do the same thing on the carpet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, what if he took the carpet and hung off the bottom of it on the first side and then as he made his way over, he'd be all right. You know what I mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, Vax, and Keyleth, as you guys are having this conversation, something catches the corner of your eye, and you watch something just go (tss), just whizz past from the bottom of the ravine to the top.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We saw that. We saw that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You saw something quickly just go by.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I get a better look, can I look and see if I see it again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the three of you guys make a perception check as you kind of come up to the edge and look.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is this related to dragons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is not related to dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then that is a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you're seeing little things, just right out of the middle of the light, you can see something shifting above and below you. You guys have a little better view. You still can't quite see-- the length of your Darkvision is too far for you to see what is below you or necessarily what's above--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I, as a quick reaction, grab the rope bridge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So you're still off to the side, just holding onto the bridge? Okay. You are beginning to watch what looks to be figures. Humanoid bodies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I have a theory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just tumbling past. One of them hits the edge of the bridge and it keeps spinning off as it disappears into the darkness above.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a weird theory. I'm going to grab-- what do I have that I can do this with?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But they look like spirits falling upwards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch a couple more go by, and they are nearly skeletal bodies falling upward. But, as you watch a couple more go by, they're limp, somewhat, but still moving as they scoot past.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's just get across here, shall we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to use Divine Sense, now. Just to confirm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wait about a minute or so before one comes close enough to hit the sense, but there is an undead energy that passes past, and both you and Kerr have this moment from across the ravine from each other, seeing this.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Gonna throw up the horns.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's me to you, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Try and clock them, see if it's the same bodies over and over again. If it's an infinite loop of falling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: An infinite loop of falling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so I wanna get a good look at one of them as they go by.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it's a gif.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six seconds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three or four more stumble past, and they're getting more and more rapid. And they're different sizes, they do not appear to be the same bodies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pick up Pike and try to barrel roll across.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Barrel roll across. As you're making it across, three more come tumbling up, two of them too far away, but one of them does reach out with its arms as it tumbles past you, and swats out to try and grab you. I need you to make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got this. Oh, you got such a bonus. Come on, girl!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Such a bonus, huh? Such a bonus. Look at Matt's face. Look at his face.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, fuck no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, come on. No, come on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do they both make that roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's the one driving the broom. She's having to try and maneuver.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to interject, and I know that I didn't make that fast enough, but at some point I would already like to be moving to interject in this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, as you're watching them start going across, you get a step out onto the bridge--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not going onto the bridge, I'm pulling out my gun--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, Pike has a thing that she can help people with their--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: War God's Blessing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's an attack roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: War gods don't help you survive, they help you kill shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do what you're gonna do, Mercer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was gonna start skeet-shooting at some point, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you and Pike to both make strength saving throws.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: How far away is this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about 30 feet from you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What about from Keyleth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About the same, so you guys are on the other side of the ravine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's got a plus four on strength. Nine for me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 13 for Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get grabbed and yanked off the broom. Pike manages to hold the broom, but currently Pike is not the current driver of it, and so she's clutching a broom that's just floating in the gravity. You watch as both Pike and Vex go from careening off to tumbling upward into the darkness above.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they both attached to the broom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Vex is pulled off the broom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But she's still tethered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's still tethered, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does Keyleth have an action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, the two of you can both make an action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, my first action, I was just pulling to try and skeet-shoot and sharpshoot with Bad News to hit the undead that had grappled her, and I assume I have spend a grit to get him to let go. To shove him off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of the nature of the rapid movement, you are at a disadvantage on this attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You still have the inspiration, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I still have that d12 inspiration.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt? Watching this, I'm going to pull Whisper out and watch to see my sister falling through the air, and if I see her falling, I'm going to throw the dagger at her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. She's falling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Down or up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm watching him and I'm watching her, and if she goes-- how far away is she from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, she's about 30 feet out from the ravine, and now tumbling upward, she's about 50 feet from you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Cause he's on the other side, correct?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, for fuck's sake, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Misfire?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Misfire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All righty. Keyleth's gonna go. Seeing Percy misfire, Keyleth is going to grab a Grasping Vine on the side of the wall, and she's going to go for that broom. 'Cause both Pike and her are still grabbing onto that broom, yeah?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm throwing Whisper at Vex. I'm doing it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vine, unfortunately, only has a range of 30 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said she was 30 feet away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's 30 feet out from the center of the ravine and is now 15, 20 feet up in the air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can she not hit the wall, get a vine off the side of the wall and bring her down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The opposite side? Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got a 60-foot range to this spell, plus 30 feet from the Grasping Vine, right? Or is it 30 and 30? I thought you were still grabbing onto the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm tethered to the broom.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, man! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look, I'm trying to work out-- you guys do a lot of things really fast. I'm trying, I'm working with you, so please bear with me on this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grasping Vine! What? What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're like a loan officer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't taunt the DM.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to sell you this house, but there's some shit we need to go over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. I'm going to ask you, Keyleth, to go ahead and make just a general dexterity check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just general dex? What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is how fast you're able to enchant a spell, which requires an incantation and the release of the spell's effect, thus summoning the vine and causing it to lash out. This is just a general, base DC, I need you to go ahead and just roll and add your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got it, you got it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was a natural 19, so that is plus my dex, which is plus two, so 21. Hah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't hah, don't hah the DM!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, (yells, grunts).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as Bad News misfires, you watch as the front of it just, this burst of black smoke bursts outward, and this look of utter horror on Percy's face. Keyleth rushes out, and grabbing the edge of the rope bridge to get enough of a reach out there, you watch as her hair lifts up and part of her body begins to just drift upward, but she holds on and reaches out with the staff, and, using the strength of her force of will, the edge of the stone above the ravine cracks open and suddenly you watch where there is no life, a piercing flash of dark green shoots outward, a vine freshly grown from the edge of the stonework reaches out and grabs, wrapping around the broom itself and holding it taut. You watch as the vine and the entire group shifts upward. You're suddenly pulled, you're still grappled by this undead zombie-like corpse, and Pike is currently clutching onto the broom as hard as she can as you both impact at the end. With your weight and the creature's weight, I now get to see if the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vine holds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, not the vine. The vine magically holds. It's the chain that attaches you to the broom. Yeah, okay. So that holds. It goes taut, you're held there. The creature's still clutching you right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are my arms restrained?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your arms are held to, yeah. Actually, 'cause you're still held there, I want you to go ahead and make another acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Holy fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Acrobatics. That's Pike. Acrobatics. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still grappled, it's still holding on to you, but you manage to swivel out of its grasp, as it's trying to pull you in, and it's starting to try and bite into you. As you glance upward, now that you're drifting, dangling roughly 60 feet up, you look up, and you can see what is the top of the ravine, and it is a writhing mass of hundreds and hundreds of undead corpses that are all reaching out for you, their different-boned claws all extended, going (rasping), trying to just pull you towards them into empty air, as you dangle, looking up into that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. My. God.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everything's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everything's fine, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, the vine pulls the broom, Pike, you, and the creature up towards the edge of the wall. So you're still 30 feet up, but you're slammed into the side of the wall, now, the vine is just holding the broom taut against the edge of the rocks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I love you! You're amazing! Can I just take out-- I just have a dagger, can I pull out my dagger and try to jam it up into the zombie's-- under his chin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. It's going to attempt to bite attack you, by the way. Which it does not do with a two. Just getting your armor, gnawing on the leather.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's all zombie drool! I am really bad at regular attacks. What do I add to this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You add your dexterity and your proficiency modifier. So it would be plus ten, I think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage. That's 1d4 plus your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, plus my dexterity. I didn't roll a 20, I rolled--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a d4 plus five, is what you're rolling for damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so eight damage. You jam the dagger up into its jaw and throat, and it slaps it out of the way. You can see it's damaged, but it's still holding on. The creature's now grabbing onto you and slamming you into the wall best it can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is Pike doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 'Cause that's what clerics do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't even see that spell, where's that spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a spell, it's her Channel Divinity ability.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It's 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so it has to make a saving throw, which it does not make. So as you look over and this zombie's biting at you and you're trying to jam at it, Pike, who's holding onto the broom, grabs the symbol of Sarenrae from around her neck and looks up and just closes her eyes for a second, and as they flash open again, there's no pupils, just white, bright, vibrant, radiant eyes. This small shockwave bursts off her, and you watch as the zombie goes (gasps) just turns into ash and disintegrates, its body just tumbling in chunks and pieces up into the ravine above you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I would look down at Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike is below you, still holding onto the broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're amazing! That was amazing! This was a mistake. How do we get down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. Keyleth?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm holding on, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where's the carpet, where's the carpet, where's the carpet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The carpet is not what we need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few more corpses start tumbling up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The rope that is currently tied at the other end of the ravine, where they're currently above us, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, they're about 30 feet above you guys on the opposite side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and reverse rappel with the rope, the other end of the endless rope, up to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, as a bonus action, I can switch the direction of the vine to lash out at the same creature as a bonus action, so can I grasp a vine and hand them off and stair-step them down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the vine is attached at a base, it's almost like it grew out of the ground, so what Grasping Vine allows you to do, is you can-- wherever it's based at, it pulls it to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. It just says, until the spell ends, you can direct the vine to lash out at the same creature on my bonus action. So.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't do damage. What it does is it just grasps and pulls towards it. So what you can do is, each turn you can change the target. If you change the target, it's gonna release the broom and they're both gonna tumble up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I don't wanna do that. But I can't change the origin of the vine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not without casting the spell again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna reverse-Batman this shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you start reverse-rappelling up the side. What's everyone else doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where's Grog and the flying carpet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, Kerrek, and Keyleth are all still on the other side with Kima and Allura. They're all on the other side of the ravine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get off the rug, get off the rug. Get off the rug, now, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not on the rug!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Isn't anyone on the rug? That's why I asked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rug is still with them, it's on the other side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back where it was. Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nobody's taken the rug across--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The rug's a terrible idea, right now, anyway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't get on the rug, so one of you lighter people, will you go get those two, please?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just, I'm going up super fucking fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you rappel up the side. While they're holding on there, one more corpse tumbles up past. It's going to attempt to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I-- no, I can't do that. I'm like floating, basically. Basically I'm like falling and just held onto a broom that's being held onto the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, if you were to try and take a shot, you could try, but you'd be at disadvantage for all your attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to try to-- any zombies or undead that come near us, I want to try to shoot them and at least ricochet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing, Kerr?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If nobody else on this side is getting on this carpet, then I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Kerrek hops on the carpet and it begins to lift above the ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I get on it as well and still maintain the concentration on my Grasping Vine?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But why would you do that, because you've gotta put two people on that carpet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're trying to put them on the carpet, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It can hold four or five people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm trying to hold the concentration on their Grasping Vine so they don't get fucked. So I'm going to get on the carpet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, if you get hit by something that falls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. But I have advantage on concentration checks these days.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hang on, I'm coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no, that's the thing. Percy's on his way to save us, so you guys just try to hold onto that carpet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Get across, we need people to pull us back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, Grasping Vine's not a concentration spell. It's a bonus action, and-- no, no, it's a concentration spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura, watching this happen, grabs Kima and Dimension Doors across to the other side, sets Kima aside, and just stays there, waiting carefully.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan does have Dimension Door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He does. He could do it for himself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And one other person of equal size, which is only Pike. And Kima, technically, but Kima's already gotten across.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sucks, 'cause Scanlan could've taken Kima.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan also has a plan, if you guys are about to really fucking die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're just waiting. Kerrek and Keyleth are going across. Are you guys going just directly across, or are you going towards Vex and--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well, if they were to fall, I'm heading wherever below that is, toward them, to offer support if they lose it. I'm also ready to Turn Undead if a big cluster of these things comes towards us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm maintaining concentration while floating next to Kerr on the carpet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys, as the carpet heads out, you hearing the carpet as you move forward, Kerrek, you barrel roll the carpet and begin heading upward to float underneath where Pike and Vex will be. As you begin heading upward, it's funny you mention that. What were singular bodies tumbling upward are now groupings. Four or five, almost chained together, like these small balls of just limbs and bones and gnashing zombified teeth begin just (falling sounds) upward. One of them slams into the bridge and scatters out, sending a number of bodies spinning outward, broken arms and limbs from the impact. The bridge itself cracks a bit, and you watch as the center of it is still being held by a rope, but it is currently not overly walkable without holding the rope to get across.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can use the rope just to steady yourself on the carpet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of these clusters starts making its way upwards towards where the carpet is.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If I'm steering the carpet, can I dodge away from this? Because even if I Turn it, they will have velocity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. You have not driven a magic carpet before. I would ask you to go ahead and, let's see, for this? Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intelligence check, just a straight d20 plus your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Oh. That is a-- just straight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, plus your modifier, whatever that is.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Wait, my proficiency modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Oh, yeah, no. That's an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, moving this across, you're basically watching this thing come careening upwards, and you're trying to shift out of the way to maintain momentum and have this not impact you, but both the nerves of what's happening, the unfamiliarity with the change in gravity and not running a carpet before, you move out of the way just as it slams into the upper corner, causing the carpet to shift and quake. Oh man.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Can I push Keyleth hard enough to get her to the other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys were heading upward, so if you were to kick her off, she would probably still arc upward at this point. You guys are essentially, in theory, you're below the ravine if this were normal gravity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How close are we to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are about 30 feet across, 'cause the movement speed of the carpet is, if I recall, from what I told you, right, it was 30 feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're not close to Pike and Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet. You're halfway there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just so you know, the second my feet hit the stone of the upper wall, I'm going to hold on-- I no longer have to repose, I've got the spider, I'm going to double-dash towards them with the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as they get hit, Percy has just made it up the wall to you and Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm just tying them to the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Double-dash got you there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If Kerr's kicking me off, I'm reaching for Pike and the broom and still trying to maintain concentration while trying to reach for those guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, well, first and foremost. First and foremost. Oh man, this got really complicated. I love it, it's great. I-- okay. I would like both Kerr and Keyleth to roll strength saving throws to maintain hold on the carpet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far are they from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about-- right now? 35, 40 feet.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You get a plus three, by the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do. From being just near him. He's so awesome that when you're near him-- Paladins, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm on the very edge. Close as I can get, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? Okay. Kerr?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both maintain your grip on the carpet. I will say, for the sake of this, Keyleth, make a concentration check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have my advantage 'cause of Warcaster, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That one's cocked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just need to beat a ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, yeah, I beat that ten with a 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you maintain concentration, you maintain hold of the carpet. The carpet rights itself, the corpses go spinning upward into the abyss above. The carpet has now spent the rest of its turn getting into position to guard you and Pike, just in case it's necessary. So. You guys are in place. Percy, you've tied the rope--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tied them, holding onto everybody, and I just have been yelling, pull!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got them on the rope, pull the rope down!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who else is on that side of the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, it's Kima and Allura as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, as many people as can start running out that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all grab the rope that's currently affixed to Percy, that hopefully you've been holding this whole time. I'm imagining you would've.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, where's the rope? There's so much going on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to use my spider-walk ability to actually just maintain everything and just keep an eye out and try and safety-spot everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you go ahead and start pulling the rope. Kima and Allura help out. Allura's not doing much, eight, unfortunately, but Kima is.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And we were technically below them. I'll just bring the carpet towards them and elevator them up if I can get below.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, cool. So now we have Kerrek and Keyleth. Keyleth, are you releasing the vine? Because it's currently what's holding them against the stone wall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you grabbing onto the carpet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both have ropes they're grabbing onto from Percy, and they're being pulled below. Do a strength check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I let go, and can I switch to a Gust cantrip to try and push us down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cantrips are very simple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a 19, so 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys get right to the edge. You look down as you see this one cluster of what looks to be maybe 20 or so bodies comes up, not as a ball, but what looks to be almost a giant skeletal hand made up of smaller corpses is tumbling upward and reaching, its outstretched, large, maybe 15-foot-wide grasp towards this carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I do Channel Divinity on that shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So what is your save DC for your spell DC?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog's still on the other side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no, this is perfect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So for your Channel Divinity here, it's eight plus your proficiency bonus plus your charisma modifier.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: So eight plus... that'd be seven plus, yeah, that's right.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: 14. Oh, you're right, you're right, 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, yeah. All right. Cool. So, with that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really fucking badass.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a pain in our ass, but it's really awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The visual of it is amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm enjoying this quite a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dead bodies falling to the ceiling, reaching up, yeah, no, it's cool. This is definitely a Brendan Frasier movie.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, for sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so. As this giant, skeletal hand reaches upwards to basically scoop up the entirety of the cluster of everyone gathered right at the edge of this ravine, the carpet pushing them inward, it's almost gonna sandwich the party into the palm of this, you watch as Kerrek, clutching the edge of the carpet, reaches up from beneath his armor and grabs his own holy symbol, clutches it firm in his grasp and looks upward, shouting a whispered word that doesn't reach anybody's ears but the ones that it's intended for. And as it does, you watch as a piercing bit of light jettisons in an upward-- or downward direction from your perspective-- towards this hand. As it reaches out its outstretched zombie fingers, it bursts, and as it does, the hand is scattered outward in a small shockwave. All the bodies, once linked, are now sent into separate, disparate spinning corpses that all reach out helplessly as they all go scattering past upward and disappearing into the ravine above. With that final push, you all get down on the opposite side of the ravine, safe and sound.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god. I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I grab you and give you a big kiss. Big, sexy, still-tied-up makeout kiss. Hey, well done not passing out this time. Good for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks for saving me, darling. You.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog and Scanlan are waving from the other side of the ravine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I untie the broom and the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't untie it all, I like being attached to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I go over to Percy and I say, smitten. Smitten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I slowly start shoving Keyleth back towards the ravine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just Scanlan's arms crossed, and his eyes are very wide, and he's kind of looking around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan's with Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're just kind of watching the fucking show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. What do you think?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we just leave 'em.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, you're right, let's go." You watch as Scanlan and Grog turn around and start walking back from where you guys came.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. Thank you. Fucking thank you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That... that... so this is pretty much just a Tuesday for you guys, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I give Kerr a big hug. Thank you. Saved the day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A giant impact, as behind you, another sphere of these corpses slams into the bridge, causing it to snap and go limp against the upper portion of the ravine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, okay, how are we going to get the last-- there's still a rope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I had a question. So I take one of my five empty jugs out of the Bag of Holding, and I go to the edge. While they were up there doing all that shit. I look down and I just throw it straight down as hard as I can. Does it immediately go whoop?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Upwards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bit of an arc. You want to pee, don't you?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I see what you're doing, and I grab just whatever, a rock or something. I try to throw it straight across.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Because it should fall at first, but if it's 50/50, it should fall and then fall the other way, and it'll go right across.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, so if you did a jump.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like Angry Birds. If you get the arc right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a great idea. You grab the end of the rope that's still tied, of our endless rope. On the count of three, Scanlan's going to jump on your back, on the count of three, they're going to make a running jump, and we're going to run, all of us holding like a giant game of tug-of-war, and just see if we can pull them across like a kite.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will pull you all into the chasm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought everyone was over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan and Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if you tie yourself to the rope, too, no matter what, we'll be able to-- so you'll at least be tethered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't somebody fly the carpet back over and then-- can't Pike fly it back over, and then she and Scanlan can bamf over, and then I can just try and make it across with the carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I could go over on the fucking broom again, dear lord. How about the bodies? Are they still flying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're still going past, and it's like little singular ones here and there, but every now and then a cluster.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thing is, I can put Grog in the necklace and bring him over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, can you backpack Scanlan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. And then what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And jump really hard?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Chain of Returning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chain of Returning is-- what's the range on that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 40 feet? Or is it 60 feet?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is somewhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a crazy idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doesn't have a range.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want to say we have it set at a 30-foot range. It's a big weapon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure, I'm down with that, 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you attaching it to your hammer?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm not attuned to that. I've got the little hammer now. Oh, sorry, the hammer, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah, that has a furthest range of 60 feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far across the chasm is the thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you attach the Chain of Returning to the hammer?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I can essentially attach it to anything, I think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like I could go back over.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was real shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much time has it been?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Has passed? I'd say you've probably hit a good minute, little over a minute since the very beginning of this endeavor. Probably a little longer. Given time to look over it since it happened, and converse about what to do.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I say, if we have a rope tied to her, we could bring her back if something bad happened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Totally, totally. All right, cool. Attach a rope to me. I bamf Trinket out so my necklace is empty, and then I take off across the channel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But we have two, are we just going to do it twice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan can get on the broom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, and Grog can get in the necklace! That's very clever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I want to fly back over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Heart pounding, this was terrifying. I'm sorry, buddy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You jump onto the broom, steel yourself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna anchor this rope also to Trinket, just so there's extra weight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket happily allows that anchoring to happen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, you guys feed it, I'm gonna be ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You barrel-roll across. Across the way--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanna try to time it so I avoid as many as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are-- there's a small cluster that comes by, and a couple of minor individual bodies on this side. Make two dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that one's totally fine, too. That's a 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just whip past, out of the grasp. You hear the clacking of bones--

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The water's still going up, and it's still careening and falling through the cracks. It's not a very strong stream, it's just this-- like a small faucet turned on, it's all just trickling upwards, appearing, but that gem being currently blocked seems to have had an effect on the room behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To the right or the left?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the right!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Going to the right, but hold on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Same marching order as before?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna go a little bit ahead, 20 feet ahead, looking for traps. I doubt, but I want to check for traps. Stealth and traps, stealth and traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still on the same stealth roll you had before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, great. So traps, investigation is 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The floor doesn't appear to be trapped as you coast forward around the other side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Check the ceiling. I look at the ceiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like a ceiling. It's about 25, 30 feet in height throughout this chamber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And as we move through this passage, what do we see as we get closer to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And we'll pick up for that next week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I knew it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 'Cause it is late. Patrick, are you gonna join us for Skype next week?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or in LA?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Actually, I am coming out to LA. It's an issue of how quickly I'll be able to get to PAX afterwards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: 'Cause I'm doing PAX South after my LA trip. Really hoping that I will be in your neck of the woods Thursday night. If not, if you want me around for the finish, I would happily Skype in from San Antonio or wherever that is. Up to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ash might be able to Skype in, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dual Skype, maybe. Well, let us know, please do.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I would be delighted.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for handling Skype so well. It is not easy to be on the other side of that camera. It's so frustrating.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It's certainly not as nice as being up close and personal with you all, but I'm just glad that I am not experiencing vast technical eras-- eras, yes, errors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we're glad to have you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, thanks so much. All right, well we'll be--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks for saving us, Kerr!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughs) There was a delightful amount of mutual saving.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And, as always, don't forget to tune in for Talks Machina on Tuesday night with Brian Foster. I'm sure he's going to have at least two of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will be announced as the week progresses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Throughout the week, I'm sure, he will announce two of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope they got those Tetris stickers again that they had a year ago, those Tetris stickers were dope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see what they got. Thank you guys so much, rest well, you guys as well. We'll see you next week, and is it Thursday yet? Have a good night!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice one! [no audio] [end of transcript]
